Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: tigst4r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel for 4 nights in Febuary 2012, The botel was in a good location for sight seeing and transport around the Dam, The rooms are clean and basic and set out as cabins. We had continental buffett style breakfast, Fantastic floating chinese restraunt a few yards on the pier, Great value for money we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “For that price, couldn`t be better.”
Reviews.Author: Andre1502
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews about the Botel before booking and most of them made clear that this would be a good choice for a budget travel. They were right. The rooms are small as a boat cabin would be, but clean, comfortable and equiped with telephone, cable TV, heater and private bathroom ( those are really small but once again, private!) . What else could I expect from a hotel that charges around 85 Euros in Amsterdam where you could easily pay over 200 for a 3 star night? The experience of staying at a Boat is nice. Although It is fixed on an old port, you can feel a very soft move of the water. Nothing to worry about. The location isn`t the best but pretty easy to access. From behind the Centraal Station you can take a ferry ( for free ) to cross the IJ River and drop off just beside the Botel. The ferry runs until midnight. After that, a van service runs to and from the hotel to another spot ( the van is free too ). So, instead of taking the ferry to the Botel, you take another one just to cross the the river and the van will stop by all night long in very short periods... very simple! I got breakfast Included booking at booking.com. Although there are sime types of bread, scramble eggs, ham, cheese, Oranje juice, coffee and tea, i wouldn`t pay 10 Euros for each person. So, let`s say that it`s a very good continental breakfast but not good enough for 10 Euros. Smoking is not allowed in the hotel but to smell marijuana in the aisle was not something difficult. Well It`s Amsterdam and here it`s allowed, but not inside the hotel. Still, some guests seem not to care. I have to say that I saw one guest being reprimended by and employee. Overall It was a great stay. Come if you don`t care spending some time ( not much ) between downtown and your hotel, if you look for a cheap but comfortable and secure place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The thin walls ruined it for us :(”
Reviews.Author: Myakhin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel for three nights and found it to be perfectly adequate as far as the accommodation is concerned. The beds are comfy and the rooms are fairly spacious. The shower/toilet is tiny but you expect this on a boat - the shower was better than expected with lovely hot water. The room was cleaned daily, beds made and clean towels provided. The bar prices were very reasonable and the bar area suited us well as we have two teenagers and were able to leave them up paying pool when we went to bed. A couple of the reception staff were very curt (both female) but the remainder were friendly and helpful. The downside for us was due to the thin walls - we were expecting to hear noise from adjoining rooms as it is a boat but unfortunately the couple in the next room were VERY LOUD carrying out their 'bedroom activites' very late into the night and early in the morning! We did speak to reception at 1am on the second night and they did ask the people to be quiet which helped. This is not a fault of the Botel but must be taken into consideration as I'm sure we are not the first or last to experience this. All in all though it is what it is and was an ideal base with teenagers. We would stay again but would definitely take ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “leisure”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not happy no chambermaid service. Had to make own bed. No toilteries provided. Sent email after booking to request double and got two singles. Hotel also changed location ....

Reviews.Title: “Good value and central location”
Reviews.Author: busyfeetz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal location and excellent value. Come out of the rear of the central station, walk to the far right of the pier and the ferry to the botel is approx 8 mins. The boat itself is stuck out in a bit of an industrial type area but it's clean, comfy and ideal enough to lay your head close enough to central Amsterdam. The rooms were cleaned all the days we stayed. The showers and bathrooms were small, ship cabin like but you get what you pay for. The room was warm and the bed comfy. All I want when staying in a good value place! The breakfast was plentiful... Cereal, toast, fruit, yoghurt, croissants.... Again, excellent value. After reading some reviews, I was expecting a bit of noise but it was very quiet at night. We did ask for a double room rather than a twin which is allocated as standard when booked online but the staff changed our room on request... Cheerfully! Lovely pleasant staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMSTERDAM BOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ELWICKSWigan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form a weekend stay on the Amsterdam Botel. we had a fantastic time. we wasn,t looking forward to going after reading some of the reviews. but we went with an open mind.Ok the cabins are not as good as on a cruise ship. but they was very spacious, and the bathroom was adiquat. the shower was great.We only took hand luggange so i didn,t take an Hair dryer but was able to hire one from reception for a deposit of 10 euro,s. The Breakfast was continental. with hot and cold buffet. but there was Sausage / Bacon/ Beans and boiled eggs so there was enough to eat. the Bar also did Snacks. such as Cheese Toasties. and Beefburgers. The Bar prices was very Reasonable as well. alot cheaper than in centeral Amsterdam. We also ate lunch at a restaurant very close to the Botel. on the Fri and on the Saturday night we ate there in the evening. because we was so tired after walking round amsterdam. The Free Ferry from Amsterdam Train station was great to the Botel.it was so fun it takes about 10/15mins to the dock near the Botel. So we would recomend the BOTEL as somewere to stay.it was very clean and the Staff was very Helpful.its not as posh as some Hotels but u realy only sleep there and get changed to go out so for what it was it was very good.The beds was also very comfortable and there was NO NOISE at night like there would have been if we had stayed say at the Ibis or a centeral Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel”
Reviews.Author: oldham4
Reviews.Content: We found the acomodation clean tidy the staff were helpful The breakfast facilities were good with mainly continental style breakfast yet a little cooked meat and cereals.The rooms albeit small were comfortable enough wit a good view of the harbour and boats Basic shower and wc facilitie with a very small bathroom Yet overall a very good base to stay in Amsterdam with a regular and reliable ferry service to and from the wharf to the city centre Dont expect the Ritz yet for what you pay its good overall value and we would definitely reccomend a visit

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: denise p
Reviews.Content: very clean, the staff are a nightmare apart from 1 young man who was working the evening shift, the chiness lady on reception would rather play bubble bobble than deal with the staff and if you have the misfortune to meet basil himself a big tall man who can only deal with 1 person at a time. Took him 20 mins to take my order for a coffee.wouldnt recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel - Love It or Hate It ! Your Decision?”
Reviews.Author: doyley196
Reviews.Content: This will be my second review of The Amstel Botel as myself and Wife have just returned from a long weekend break to Amsterdam. Firstly and to clear the air - I've been reading reviews about the Botel on Trip Advisor and I am amazed that people go here if there expecting the Ritz? The Botel is a cheap alternative, offering a decent standard of bed and breakfast. As stated, The rooms are not massive. We stayed in room 217 which is located on the reception level, facing the NDSM Werf Pier and Amsterdam skyline...............The Best Side! Our room consistered of a queen size bed, a small coloured tv, radio alarm clock, wardrobe and drawer space. And a small toilet, shower and sink. Please note that all of the before mentioned are cleaned daily, towels and small collection of toiletries and if you require extra items, pillows etc then just ask. Alarm calls from reception are also bookable. If your flight is a early departure, you can also pre book the shuttle bus to take you to the 24 hour ferry, situated directly opposite Central Station. Getting to the Botel couldn't be easier. From the airport, catch a train to Amsterdam Central. Once there, walk to the rear of the station, cross over the road and turn left. Next, you need to get on a boat. Head to Pier 1 (Far End), you'll see NDSM WERF. The boat is free and runs every 30 minutes. The boat does not stop and delivers you directly next to the Botel. "What's Easier!" Boat timetable for LAST boat only - Fri / Sat - 00.45hrs Sun / Mon - 23.45hrs. Don't worry if you miss the last boat, catch the ferry to Buiksloterweg - runs every 10 minutes, 24 hours a day. Once over the other side, wait infront of the building directly opposite the landing stage. The Botel shuttle bus will turn up. It's free! Great Tip! We purchased all our evening meals using Group On Vouchers. I saved a small fortune. We had Thai, Turkish BBQ all-you-can-eat and Indian. I reckon we saved approx Â£75 GBP on the 3 meals Group On is free to subscribe, just go to there Dutch site and use Google Translate............Easy! If anyone requires any help with any of the above, please send a message and I will try and answer. Have a great time, We did! Weather was fantasic for March, sunny ever day. S + J. xxx

Reviews.Title: “Bargain!!”
Reviews.Author: ambyth86
Reviews.Content: The only thing negative i can say about this hotel is it was a bit of a nightmare to check in, lots of people and rooms not ready. Its in a perfect location if you dont mind a short ferry ride back and to from the hotel to central station. The free shuttle ferries do stop just after midnight after then you have to get the shuttle bus. The rooms were clean and comfortable and even had channel 5 on the TV!! Breakfast was basic but very nice. Yes the boat does rock slightly but you do get used to it. I will most definitely be returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: sexylisa85
Reviews.Content: We visited Amsterdam in February 2012. We stayed at the Amstel Botel and it was better than I expected it to be. The botel itself is not far from the central train station; there is a free ferry boat that takes you directly to the botel. The ferry boats run until midnight daily and there is a free shuttle bus that drops you off outside the botel after midnight so the service is excellent. The only downside in my opinion was that we had twin beds instead of a double bed. The bed wasn't the most comfortable bed ever but I've slept in worse!The room itself wasn't very big but it was clean with its own shower and toilet which was my main concern. Breakfast was included in our stay which was lovely! Highly reccomended. We can't wait to go back, we'll definately be going again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I was expecting.............................”
Reviews.Author: lynn c
Reviews.Content: I booked a mini break (cheap) for my husbands Christmas pressy so whilst not expecting the best hotel this was not what I expected. For the majority of travellers I am sure that for just putting your head down it would be adequate but the 3 star rating is pushing it, for us it was more like a 2. In essence this hotel is basically a decommissioned ferry converted into a hotel on a budget. Our room was very small (that was expected) but the 'bathroom' was joke, you couldn't move in the shower and the shower curtain didn't fit, you couldn't sit properly on the toilet due to it proximity to the sink and the shower - it was a wet room with no space. The dÃ©cor was very shabby and dated and the TV was a portable - hey small to match the rest of it. The bar area consisted of four tables with plastic chairs and a juke box (that wasn't working when we where there) and a pool table in bad need of re felting. the breakfast was a buffet affair which catered for most tastes but it did put us in mind of being in youth hostel. On the up side the staff were lovely, polite and very helpful. the ferry ride from Centraal Station to the Botel was free and added the fun to the trip. Would I go back there never but I feel that it would make as fun place for the younger generation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “botel”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed for 2 nights,the rooms are clean & warm, bathroom was tiny you couldnt swing a cat in there!! As a couple in there late 20s the location was bad. you had to get a ferry across to the botel, then after 12 at night that ferry didnt run so you had to get on another ferry then a bus to get back to the boat it was crazy...at night it is a big creepy walking to get the ferry. We have been in Amsterdam a good few times but we will never stay there again, next year we defo be staying in the Greenhouse effect hotel its in the centre of everything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Whats not to like”
Reviews.Author: suziet-10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights and we were very happy with the room,It was large enough not at all cramped.The bathroom was adequate for our needs and was very clean.The breakfast was really nice with a good choice,Cerials,croissants,continental,and english breakfast.All very nice.The staff are helpful and eagre to help. Our TV broke down and we thought we would be stuck with it.Half an hour later the guy apologised for the delay and gave us next doors TV.There is a free ferry from the central station over to the Botel it takes 10 minutes and they go every 30 minutes.It is in an industrial area and there are other boats around,but we only used it as a base but we were quite happy and would gladly recommend the Amstel Botel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, quite far from central, didnt even tell me I lost passport!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Amstel Botel a couple of years ago when it was near the central station, it was easy, quick and convienient, but now it's a ferry away, I found it quite a far way away. I won't be going back in the future ( only due to distance. ) Staff were nice, especially a young boy (around 18) behind the bar who was incredibly polite. Pool table doesn't work either. The main reason I am writing a review is because the day I checked out, I left my passport in reception. Someone found it and handed it in, but the staff never bothered to even phone me (or emergency numbers on my passport) to notify me that it was there. I know it's my responsibility to keep it safe, but even just a little phone call would have been nice as I had to rush back to the hotel within an hour of my flight taking off. Apart from this, the room was basic, clean and comfortable. Shower/bathroom was absolutely tiny so not a good idea if you're rather large. Also I booked a smoking room but none of the rooms on board are smoking. Which was a disappointement.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Brazil_Nut_16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2011, I pulled up and actually thought we may have been lost, as it looked like we were in some kind of industrial area, unfortunately this was just the location of the boat! The rooms themselves were tiny and bare, with a bathroom equally as tiny and bare. I felt like I was in the D class of a cruise boat. I could have lived with all of this, as I prefer not to spend to much time in my hotel when on holidays. The location, I was not bearable for me. We had to wait for the ferry (which only came every half an hour) to get anywhere close to civilisation. My friends and I ended up having to run through Amsterdam in the rain, so that we didn't miss the last ferry at 12am. If you miss this, you have to catch two buses that take you completely out of the way, before actually getting back to where you need to go. I don't even want to know how much longer this journey would take. If you are young and want to stay out and explore Amsterdam at night, and not be forced to come home at 12 am, this is not for you

Reviews.Title: “Budget Holiday”
Reviews.Author: XXXRuby_Soho
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went with another couple to celebrate my 21st birthday, we mainly choose the botel as we were looking for a budget hotel and liked the idea of staying on a boat. yes, it is very basic but you get what you pay for. we spent Â£150 each for flights and hotel for a 3 day trip and i personally think that's pretty good value for money! the staff were friendly and the rooms VERY basic (but also clean) but altogether we weren't there to spend too much time on the boat! the top deck is nice in the sunshine, chilling on a hammock with the tiny mini fridge that they call a bar! my only quibble was that it was sold for being close to the city centre but actually you have to get a ferry (free) across the river. this is fine if you are planning on coming back at around 12am but if you are looking at staying out later you have to try and catch the bus - we ended up jumping on the wrong one and the bus driver took pity on us and dropped us as close to the boat! i'd recommend this for a group of friends looking at staying somewhere a little different and aren't too fussed about the rate of the room and are much more looking at enjoying all that Amsterdam has to offer ;)

Reviews.Title: “Go directly to Jail â€“ do not pass Go, do not collect Â£200 !”
Reviews.Author: jarna482
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worse place I have ever had the misfortune to stay in !!! It was like stepping aboard a prison ship. The rooms were like something out of a mental asylum. The decor was awful. Bland to the point of no return ! The pitiful bathroom...( if you can actually categorise it as one ) was so diabolical that it was probably more hygenic to go without a shower rather than to step onto the filthy shower tray and turn on the trickling drip of the cold shower whilst desperately trying to avoid skin contact with the mould ridden shower curtain ! I can only assume that anyone who has rated this place 2 stars or more, clearly spent a huge amount of time on their trip in one of the cafes and was therefore in no fit state to notice and therefore give any kind of factual review !!!

Reviews.Title: “there are much better options”
Reviews.Author: JosePLP
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel as a holiday's package. I thought it would be near the city center, but totally wrong. You need to get a ferry which is free, good point, but you depend on the timetable during your hole trip. It takes easily 30 min to get near the center and it is impossible to go back to the hotel for a rest. If you leave it, make sure you will not need to come back until the end of your day. The hotel simply has no personality. If what you are looking for is the little extra touches, here you will find nothing like that. They let you leave your bags upon arrival, which is a nice touch. But there is a lot of minus. The hotel restaurant only opens for breakfast and around the boat there is nothing else but a bar(not very cheap). Internet cost a fortune (which I never understood since the other restaurant has it free). When we checked in to our room the duvet cover was inside out and the bin dirty. I though during the stay someone would fix it, but never happened. The worst was the boat moving all the time. I ended up feeling seasick during the hole trip. If you are a little bit sensible, do not recommend the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey”
Reviews.Author: lisa a
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the Botel for only one night, which was fine for a fly by over night. However, the room stunk of cigarettes. I literally had to breath through my mouth until I fell asleep and I'm truly not fussy and make the best out of any situation. Which I did at the Botel, so it wasn't terrible. The people were nice, but breathing clean air is definitely up there on my list of must haves.

Reviews.Title: “Average and a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Mads33
Reviews.Content: The Botel is ok although the breakfast is not very good. You should not however expect the rooms or the experience to be in any way romantic. Also the botel is a bit outside of city centre which was ok for us but you should take it into consideration before booking. Although we were not really dissatisfied with anything in particular the botel does not offer great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,basic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: petti120
Reviews.Content: We have stopped here several times and realise we need to take pillows as beds not great for comfort! However, it is clean and staff friendly. Was worried when it moved a few years ago to where it is now from outside station, but ferry trip not too bad. I do think you get what you pay for but we have stopped in much worse places, this is a good choice if you take some aids to comfort (pillows, travel kettle etc lol)

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Much better value for money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Dazza13
Reviews.Content: Â£6 for 1 hour wifi- Â£1 10 mins 8 ball expensive bar, poor location and definitely not value for money. This is my first review and I felt compelled to steer people away if possible, If I can save just one person visiting this it has been worth the time

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ZeebsLondon
Reviews.Content: The Amstel Botel is cheap and cheerful. It's a very simple little hotel in the form of a boat. If you suffer from severe motion sickness then it might not be ideal. The hotel itself doesn't move but you can occasionally feel the water beneath the floor boards, which gives a feeling of movement. The hotel was clean and comfortable, although the shower wasn't particularly great - it was incredibly small. The bar/restaurant wasn't very good, but that didn't really bother us since we were eating out everyday, I was happy with the hotel overall and would certainly recommend it to those on a budget. Nonetheless, I probably won't stay there again myself as I'd quite like to try somewhere different and possibly stay a bit closer to the town centre (it wasn't far but it was a boat ride away). Having said that, this was my first time in Amsterdam so for all I know this is the best place there is for that price - other hotels might be awful in comparison. Who knows.

Reviews.Title: “OK......... but far from perfect!”
Reviews.Author: katcol11
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a bit of a novelty factor (hotel on water) and are ok with hostel style accomodation then go for it. Beds comfortable and clean, room basic, bathroom/shower very small, buffet breakfast good. Note that the botel does still move around a bit so not for anyone who experiences motion sickness. Also families beware - porn freely available on the room tv. Ferry to/from Centraal Station great fun and made you feel like one of the locals. Man on reception unhelpful -especially when I tried to use the internet in the bar to print off boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dily s
Reviews.Content: nice hotel location was good. there is free parking near the botel but not secured parking. rooms were small but manageable and clean. breakfast was average and the price we paid was reasonable. it takes about 10-15 minutes on the ferry to central station and then you are in the centre of all the attractions. there is night shuttle for all the hotel guest after 12 midnight. The ferry service is free.

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel - Excellent Value For Money & Service.”
Reviews.Author: doyley196
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay. Amstel Botel offers you a cheap and very plesant way of staying in Amsterdam. Directions from Central Station - Go to the rear of station to ferry terminals, walk to the far terminal, you'll see a illuminated sign saying NDSM Veer. The ferry is free, just walk on and wait until you dock at the next stop (approx. 20 minutes). You'll see the Amstel Botel directly next to landing stage. The Amstel Botel is very clean, quiet and the staff are very helpful. Joesph the night reception manager could not help you enough - Thanks! I owe You One. After midnight, The boat offers a free shuttle bus service. You catch the midnight ferry which runs every 15 minutes. The minibus is located directly in front of landing stage. If it's not there, then wait. You wont have long. Food on the Botel is basic, but tasty. Staff ensure it's topped up and hot. Rooms are cleaned daily with new towels etc - What more do you want! It's only a base to sleep at whilt you enjoy the sights of Amsterdam. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Paper thin walls, heard everything from rooms around us. No aircon. Very inconvenient location, can't just pop back anytime because you need to catch the public ferry. Something strange about the bacon at breakfast. Rusty bathroom and shower. Most unhelpful reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “worth stopping on the Botel”
Reviews.Author: lizzyjeppo
Reviews.Content: Family of four stopped for a night. Its not the ritz but more than sufficient for a bed. Great service, staff very helpful, good value. The free ferry boat is great & regular and the best thing is free parking. Would recommend but try and get a room on the ferry side of the ship rather than the side overlooking the walkway onto the ship (that side is noisy). Breakfast not bad. Search around for cheapest prices on the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: JuraGem
Reviews.Content: Had read some mixed reviews for the Amstel but it fitted in our budget so we went for it. Cracking Botel! Yes it could do with modernising but its clean, rooms were a reasonable size (considering you are on a boat) and the location was good. The ferry to get here is free and runs frequently from the central station. Staff were all very friendly, especially helpful after I had fallen and badly hurt my foot whilst out in the town. The breakfast was great, just what you need to start the day, good selection of breads (& croissants if you were there early), cereals, juice tea & coffee and all the meat and cheese you could stomach first thing. Plus a cooked section with boiled eggs, bacon & sausages. Some folk had complained about its location but I thought it was great, I wasn't visiting Amsterdam for the crazy nightlife so quite enjoyed being able to get away from that when I wanted to. If I go back to Amsterdam I would certainly stay here again and recommend it anyone heading there.

Reviews.Title: “Take ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: StewartFranklin
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to via free ferry in 10 mins. First impressions were very good as the check in staff were very efficient and helpful. The rooms are on the small side however we do not go on trips to sit in our room so this was not really an issue but I do not know how a very large person would cope with the bathroom! The bed was the comfiest I have ever slept in however its getting to sleep thats the problem! You can hear everything going on and I mean everything!!!!!!!!!!! You can feel the boat rocking at times which made me feel a bit nauseous however no one else in our party was bothered by this! The bar onboard was very reasonable where we had drinks on our return at night . The cooked breakfast items left a lot to be desired however the continental options were fine. There is a large dining room with breakfast served until 10.30 for those who don't like to rush in the morning. Some snacks are also served during the day e.g burgers however we did not eat try this so cannot comment. Would I stay here again? Maybe but only if there was no other bargain accommodation and I pack the earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Very Memorable and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: dancaroline2502
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Amstel Botel and we really enjoyed it. Prior to going, we had read reviews about how it had moved from its original location near Centraal Station. However, at the rear of the Station there is a small dock area with about 6 ferrys which take you back and forth various locations on the river free of charge. The ferry between Centraal Station and the Botel is marked 'NDSM' and takes exactly 10mins (we timed it). The ferry service is part of Amsterdams unbelievably efficent public transport system and this one runs from 7am with the last one leaving Centraal Station back to the Botel at 11:45pm. If you are heading back abit later, there is an all night ferry that goes directly across the river to another ferry port, and the Botel provide a free bus shuttle service to pick you up and take you back. The Botel itself is a little dated and basic, but so are most 2/3 star hotels in Amsterdam. The rooms were pretty small and basic, but fine if you intend on only using it as a 'base camp'. We found the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was basic continental, and there's not much to do 'on board'. There is a small bar with a TV, pool table, darts, PC - but again, fine if you intend on using it as a â€˜base campâ€™. The staff were really friendly, and always happy to chat and offer their help and opinions. We didn't experience any problems with the Botel or room, but as you are on a boat there is some slight 'swayage'! This was minimal but there were a few occassions when we would be eating in a restuarant â€˜onshoreâ€™ and felt a slight 'rocking' feeling, but we found it quite funny! I have visited Amsterdam before with friends and stayed just off Dam Square. In my opinion the Botel is great for couples of all ages or familys who want something abit different. However, if you are on a boys/girls trip and intend on getting wasted non stop, you may find the novelty wears off pretty quick and travelling back and forth becomes a hindrance. Then again, we did find that heading back on the ferry at night helped sober us up, whether we had been in a bar or coffeeshop! We have told friends and family about it and everyone agrees its a really cool idea and sounds like fun. We thoroughly enjoyed our time on the Amstel Botel and it made our few days there very memorable. The bottom line is, this is a fun, novelty place to stay which is close to the city centre. There is so much to do and see in the city that all you really need is a place to leave your luggaage and sleep at night. If you want something abit different and quirky, we would recommend you stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel just outside city centre.”
Reviews.Author: chef70
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have used the Botel , once being at its previous mooring at station plein and twice at ndsm werf , which we prefer , To get to the hotel you take the last Gvb ferry from the area just outside central station the usually run every 15 min and are free , and will drop you at ndsm werf , which is a dock area which has been transformed over the years and there are a few restaurants scattered around the area as well as a lot of warehouse units which house everything from art installations to Mtv europe which is directly opposite the dock . The botel can be scene on the left as you dock and there is a ex russian naval sub also moored there. When we checked in the receptionist was really helpful as we had arrived a day early , but she allocated our rooms and told us to see the booking dep in the morning and they would sort everything out , which we did , and they did with no charge . the rooms are a good we had a double and they have all been pretty much the same , warm comfortable and clean with a small en suite shower and toilet. There is also a good breakfast served every morning , and a bar area with reasonably priced snacks and beverages , and friendly and helpful staff. We enjoy the botel as we always find the ferry ride fun , and as we have been frequenting Amsterdam for the last 25 years we appreciate a break from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and the quiet at night , don't let the position of this hotel put you off it is always reasonably priced and a much better standard than you get with some of the city centre hotels , we should know we have stayed in about 20 of them . so all in all we love the botel and will be returning in the very near future..

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quirky, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Rabbitwarren90
Reviews.Content: The Amstel Botel is a very quirky hotel, you might not want to stay in winter though as it does sway with the current (it got quite windy during my visit and I actually fell over in my room!) The service is good, with staff speaking a variety of languages between them. Breakfast is simple yet tasty. The rooms are a little dated, but they are clean. I feel they lack facilities such as a hairdryer, kettle etc. The hotel looks like it could be a little tricky to get to, but there is a free ferry from centraal to NDSM that run every 30 mins, and a free shuttle bus to replace it at night. This is extremely convenient, as it makes the hotel close enough to the centre but far away enough to be out of the thick of it. Altogether I enjoyed my stay to the Amstel Botel, and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience, but not 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: roter_hirsch
Reviews.Content: Ambience: What can I say? It is indeed a boat! The location is very good. It's close to the Central Station - via a free ferry service that operates between the station and the hotel area. The size of the boat is very deceiving - it looks much bigger on the website. The rooms and general interior of the boat are very worn - desperately in need of refurbishment. The whole ambience is like a hostel more than a hotel. Stars: ** Room: We stayed for two nights in a double room. The room was tiny, extremely worn out - marks of damp walls. The bathroom is hardly a room at all. Quite literally just enough to fit a toilet, and a standing shower compartment. The room was not cleaned properly during room service. Bedsheets were never changed. Stars: * Service: Very good service. The staff at reception was friendly, pleasant and helpful. But apart from this, the hotel seemed to have no services at all. It's very basic, but okay. Stars: ** Breakfast Room: The botel has no restaurant, only a small bar and a breakfast room. Consistent with the rest of the interior of the boat, the room was very worn out. The breakfast buffet was much too small for the amount of people it served. The food was not very fresh - it seemed to have been out there for quite a while. Not a very wide choice of food available. The coffee was honestly the worst coffee I've ever drunk in my life. Stars: * Overall: The price is probably okay for Amsterdam standards. Usually, hotels so close to the city centre are excruciatingly expensive, so at least the price was borderline reasonable. Overall: **

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Zlifeisgood
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the 3rd floor, the room was small as European standard. It was clean with a very small and functional bathroom. The staff were very friendly and assisted with our queries on the tourist spots. Very convenient, only 15 mins away from Amsterdam Train Station and City Central.

Reviews.Title: “Simply very good..................”
Reviews.Author: m4rkym4rk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 12 nights so got to know the place quite well. All staff were very friendly and helpful they are happy to help 24/7. The rooms are basic but cleaned every day by maid. The shower and bathroom may be small-yes, but you get in the warm shower, have a wash, then get out again. If you want to have a disco in the shower with guests then I'd say get a bigger more expensive hotel with a bigger shower. Thankfully I didn't go to Amsterdam for the shower. It's quiet and scenic, with some very nice bars right on your door step. The benefit of staying here is that is that you can be relaxing at the hotel one minute and in no time you are right in the city centre. The 10 minute journey by free boat service goes at least every 30 mins during the day, then just after midnight it gets even more regular (about every 15 -20mins). After midnight itâ€™s a shorter boat ride where you are met immediately by the hotels waiting free mini bus, equipped with friendly driver who takes you to the hotel door. I've lost count of how many times I've been to the Dam, it's over 10, and I can definitely say this is one of the best value for money place I've stayed in. If you're new or nearly new to Amsterdam it gives you a quiet, secure base to work from and enjoy Amsterdam. If you've been before it's something different and far better than the average city centre hotel (unless big showers are you thing of course).

Reviews.Title: “if you are looking for price only”
Reviews.Author: faraza
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice. Once in 2007 and once in 2010. 2007 experience: The botel was located in amsterdam centraal. Just outside the centraal station. This made is easy to access the city center and the scene was also beautiful. Rooms are cheap and have all the basic necessities that one requires for the price offered. The main advantage was the location and the fact that you will actually be living on a boat with is thrilling. 2010: The boat moved farther away from amsterdam centraal station towards amsterdam Noord. Takes 10 min on ferry from centraal station to Noord. Then a 5 min walk from the stop to Botel. Nearby there are not many places as it seems to be an industrial area. There is a ship restaurant near by which offers food and we had dinner there which was actually very nice for a good price. The rooms themselves looked tired. Carpets were stained and the room was a little stuffy. The comforters had dust in them which made it difficult to sleep at night. Allergic persons should beware. rest all is ok for the price. Breakfast was normal cold breakfast with not a lot of variety. just jam, toasts stuff like that. Overall experience was good. Would only live there again if am on a budgeted trip. As one is out all day on excursions to coming at night to sleep is not bad here for the price. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: MrIanDEngland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day visit to Amsterdam and stayed in the Botel. It was clean, warm and comfortable. It is not a luxury hotel but was great value. The reception and staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was OK. If I was returning to Amsterdam I would stay again. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Jayp32
Reviews.Content: this hotel needs some serious updating. The beds are really uncomfortable, the matress isn't nice, nor are the pillows and the bed linen looks really cheap and old and has a stale smell. overall Cleanliness is acceptable but not impecable. My biggest problem was having no thermostat. Room would be either cold or you turn the heater on and it becomes boiling hot overnight, the in-house entertainment such as the tv, and the bar is all rubbish. Also the bathroom was tiny and the shower would flood causing the whole bathroom floor to become a puddle. Sound proofing between rooms and the corridor didnt exist. However the staff were freindly and helpful (but all the locals in amsterdam were). The view is also not very nice. on one side theres a rusty old submarine in the river and on the other side there's an industrial estate.

Reviews.Title: “Value 4 Money”
Reviews.Author: packyrbags
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ideal suited our purpose.. good value for money, centralised location. The hotel was fun it was very unusual. The hotel staff were efficient and professional, not much chance to build a rapport but helpful and professional. The hotel location was great very central to all main attractions with great transport links. The hotel was basic but clean and comfortable. It was a great hotel to choose for a short city break as location and value was excellent. If you looking for something with a bit of atmosphere and satff interaction then i would avoid this hotel. But as a city break hotel, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money paid. very comfortable given that its only a 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cag01
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights and it was a very good choice. good breakfast, clean rooms, clean bathroom (though small), great room service... had 10 mins boat trip to get to the station, but it was a diff experience... greatly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: LooraMagoora
Reviews.Content: Was great for what we needed, which was cheap and basic accommodation, that was close to the city centre or easily accessible. LOVED getting the ferry back and forth each time from Amsterdam central to the Botel (last stance on the left on oct 10'). It's very regular, you only have to wait 25 minutes at the most, and it takes you to within a minutes walk of the botel. Later at night there is only one ferry available but a nightbus takes you from the dock to the Botel (typically efficient dutch transportation). One of the downsides about staying on this side of the river however is that it's very industrial with basically no restaurants/shops, making traveling across the only option if you get the late night munchies. There is a restaurant beside the botel which is cool and modern but because we were on a shoestring budget we only had a few coffees there which were about 1.50 euros each. Being a boat it doesn't rock at night quite as much as you would expect although I did occasionally get jelly legs. The staff at the front desk are quite helpful, loads of free maps available. The rooms are VERY basic so don't expect any type of luxury and there was a massive stain on the quilt in our room. The toilets can smell quite strong at time as well but it's what you'd expect for the price. It's also probably worth mentioning for the red-blooded humans reading this that each room has free 24 hour porn which obviously my boyfriend was totally ecstatic about. He'd probably go back to Amsterdam and stay at the Botel for that fact alone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for One Night - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RuthFinn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay on the 23rd December. It was freezing cold so it was a relief to find our room lovely and warm. The room was basic but good value for money and very clean. We found the breakfast very fresh and a good choice. I have no complaints about the hotel, the rooms are tired but who cares when you are in Amsterdam, we only went back to sleep !! The staff were excellent and very friendly. I would defiantly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third time is a charm...”
Reviews.Author: amalmond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Botel twice before, but that was in it's 'old' location! It was slightly confusing looking for the ferry terminal - its the last one on the left and there is an LCD display board and wow they are never late. I personally loved getting the ferry, it felt authentic and a rare chance to experience the real Amsterdam. I personally didn't mind it being so far away as it was quiet and there was always something to see out of you window [or should that be porthole?] Once checked in, you are given a ferry timetable and off you pop. The hotel itself isn't concreted down any more so if you don't have you sea legs take some travel/motion sickness pills, we did and it really didn't bother us despite being worst for wear more than once....! The Botel itself is incredibly basic, but it's clean and the staff are nice - what more could you want for that price?!? We asked for more pillows, got them and there were two spare blankets in the wardrobe as it was freezing when we were there. We didn't stay for breakfast as for ten euros it didn't seem that great, the pub/cafe by boat stop do and their coffees are lovely, and their food looked nice too. The bar has a pool table, Indiana Jones pinball machine, internet access and a juke box. Pretty decent. Beer wasn't overpriced either. There are also vending machines on the floor directly above reception for those mid evening munchies!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but I loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: b00tilicious
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting 5 star accomodation, you WILL be dissapointed. The star rating of the Botel reflects the price, and I think it is very reasonable and we got a very cheap deal. You have to remember your staying on a boat...so yes the rooms, particulary the bathrooms are very small and basic. Our room was cleaned every day, we had no issues at all and found it quite comfortable. The guy on reception was lovely and changed our room so we had a nicer view :) The breakfast is pretty standard and replenished all morning..meats, bread rolls etc but they also have hot food...bacon eggs and sausage - bonus!! The bar is small but they have a dart board, pool table, juke box and tv in the bar/lounge area. We found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful!! watch out for channel 35 btw...its porn 24 hrs a day!! We LOVED taking the ferry to the centre everyday, the novelty didnt ware off for us! It was a bit daunting at first but you get used to it. If you leave Central Station via the back Noord Exit...cross the road and turn left. There is a little ferry port. The ferry you need to get on is the last one on the left and is signed NDSM. It only takes about 10mins to get across and the Botel is right there. The ferry..(which is free by the way) runs every half hour and every 15mins in rush hr. The Botel will give you a timetable when you check-in. It can be a nuisance if you just miss it and have to wait for the next one, but if you keep an eye on the time its really not a problem! All in all, we had a fantastic stay here and would definatley go again and recommend it to anyone on a budget! If you have any questions dont hesitate to contact me! :)

Reviews.Title: “GRIME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GPD1011
Reviews.Content: Absolutely filthfy, unfreindly staff Was suppose to say there for 2 nights my friend and I were celebrating our birthday, had to book another hotel after beaing 1 night in that dirty smelly room. I would suggest they employ staff that are more helpfull, freindly!! I always thought the customer comes first!! I was amazed when the receptionist was so suprised when I asked him to change my room as I was not happy with it, he couldn't understand why I wanted to change!! This so called 3 Star hotel needs to be ripped down and re-developed into the 21st Century!! Can't say that I would recommend this hotel to anyone or even admit I spent 1 night there!! We found a much nicer hotel and enjoyed a good nights sleep!! so our trip wasn't so bad after all.

Reviews.Title: “perfect if you just need somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: chellebert
Reviews.Content: we found the botel suited to what we needed for our trip to amsterdam, a place to rest. as there is so much to do, we did not find the need to spend a lot of time, but when we were there, there was a nice level of comfort, but if you do like a plump pillow, take your own. the breakfast was ok, luckily we did not have to pay, if we did we would have gone out earlier. it could be better organised, but for a small staff team, they do their best. there is nothing to do around the botel, but a free ferry service, 15 min peak 30 min off peak, will take you to amsterdam, you get off just behind centraal station (it is the furthest to your left to get back to the botel). on a last note, be aware of bikes, mopeds and small cars, they use the ferry too, and take no prisoners if you are in their way. for a budget hotel, you cannot complain, because at the end of the day you get what you pay for. although the use of the bathroom is an experience in itself. :)

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back...”
Reviews.Author: Ianzy
Reviews.Content: This is a serious budget hotel. I has the novelty of being a floating hotel, but thats where it ends. The boat is moored on the northern sector of Amsterdam which to get to you need to take a ferry, albeit free... You therefore need to keep an eye on the clock to make sure you don't miss the last one. If you do miss it you can get another ferry but you need to ring the hotel to send the shuttle bus to pick you up. On arrival my friend and I were 'greeted' at the reception by a woman who appeared to be reluctant to stop what she was doing and deal with our reservation. This same woman was behind the hotel bar one evening when we came back and kept us waiting for five minutes while she busied herself round the back before informing us 'Bar's closed!' without even making eye contact..... The rooms stank of cigarette smoke especially when the heating was on or the sun was shining in, the duvet cover had cigarette burn holes, the toilet appeared to back up and the shower bracket was broken. Breakfast was reasonable although sometimes you had to wait for tables to be cleared and clean cutlery to be provided. like I said serious budget quality.....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: spanner1607
Reviews.Content: Yes it is basic, but for the money paid we were not expecting a 5 star palace. Comfortable bed, room cleaned daily, very small shower rooms but not a problem. Clean towels given each day too. Location not so good, nothing around the botel although they do have a bar on board serving alcohol and basic snacks, plus machines selling cans, crisps and chocolate. You need to get the ferry from outside the station, its free and runs every 30mins, takes about 10 mins and drops you just a minute walk from the botel. As we booked this without checking the location, I would not if I had known booked it, but in fairness it was not a prob jumping on the ferry, its free and seemed to run till about 1am. Would recommend if you are doing Amsterdam on a buget, are a group of friends and dont mind basic. Its a bargain and we found it warm and comfortable and at the end of the day, we didnt go for spa facilities... just somewhere to crash out at the end of a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: northern_birds
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a free ferry ride from the centre of amsterdam. Ferry leaves every half hour, but make sure you get the correct ferry! Boat istself is pretty good, but don't expect a palace. Not half as nice as the stenna ferry which has great cabins for the overnight crossing from harwich. Breakfast is good and we took our bikes which made an excellent trip. Good bike ride to the Island of Marken about 14 miles up the coast. Downside was the noise at night. We stayed in a room quite close to reception overlooking the jetty. We we're woken up by a party in the next room at 2.30am on our first night and again on the 2nd night at 4.30am by people chatting in the corridor. We only stayed the 2 nights and the reception did sort out the noisey people on both occasions, asking the party goers playing their guitar and "singing" to go downstairs to the bar area. There is nothing much near where the boat is moored but it does have a bar and serves sandwiches. We took most our own food and beer as the Euro is too strong and makes everything sooooo expensive.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, not badly priced and the novelty of staying on a boat”
Reviews.Author: hjbeamish
Reviews.Content: The novelty of staying on a boat hotel appealled to myself and my partner as a last minute deal for the end of august. to amsterdam. The ferry you have to catch is just left as you come out of the back of central station (airport is about 30mins away on a train straight from airport 4.80euros for a single) and a short distance to the botel once you cross ove which is a free ferry service, just becarefull of the scooters and bikes!!!!!. every time we made our way over to the crossing we didnt have more than a 15min wait for one, which helped when it rained!!!! The staff had basic understanding of english and very informative with info on shuttle bus and ferry times, and gave us maps etc at the hotel. The rooms were basic but cleaned every day and you dont really feel the hotel move until you are in the shower!!! It was very quiet dispite sail 2010 event on all weekend which only happens every 5 yrs. breakfast was a selection of what we consider brekkie and salad!!!! but it was nothing special, would like to have seen fruit and pastries though!!!! a basic but comfortable stay and would recommend to friend and family, and consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, great views, fab place to be”
Reviews.Author: leahmarieshaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amstel Botel last week and had the most amazing stay. The staff in the hotel were all bi-lingual, very friendly, up for a laugh and very helpful. The views of the canal were brilliant. To wake up on a morning and look out to nothing but water for miles was amazing. The Botel is situated a short distance from Dam centre, it can be accessed via a (free) small ferry boat, at first this can be daunting but after a couple of journeys it becomes fun. It takes about 10 mins and drops you directly at central station. There was only one problem with this, the boat stops at midnight. Therefore getting back to hotel at 12 was a bit of a farse. You have to get a (free) boat to a different port and then a (free) shuttle bus picks you up on demand and takes you back to the hotel. Its definately worth getting a taxi from the centre back to the hotel in the wee hours on the morn if you are impatient like me. It costs arounf 25 Euros though. This is the only downfall to the Botel, but in the same sense, this hinderence is also a blessing as staying in the centre of Dam can be really intense. It's nice to retreat away from the hustle and bustle at times, and the Botel offers that in abundance. The bedrooms are basic, but what more do you want for the cheap prices. They are more than adequate for a good nights sleep and a shower. Oooo, one more thing, the boat sways...amazing when tipsy because nobody actually knows!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the experience of staying on a boat in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: BWonder
Reviews.Content: We definetely enjoyed looking out our window onto the water and seeing a Russian Sub from our room. The rooms are tiny but you have to remember, you're staying on a boat! We would have done it again for the novelty but if we visit again we will stay somewhere that doesn't require taking a ferry everytime you want to get over to the mainland area. The ferry's run about every 30 minutes but after midnight you have to take a ferry to a different spot and the hotel shuttle comes to pick you up from there (you just call them when you get there). It wasn't a big deal just a bit of a time inconvenience. The breakfast bar here was good and always full. The front desk even made a point to bring us coffee the morning we left and were waiting for the shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “A great value for money hotel... with a difference.”
Reviews.Author: rylehu
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel on our first holiday together. He left me to decide where to stay, and when I saw the Amstel Botel the novelty quickly attracted me to it, so I booked the hotel through lowcostholidays.com at great value. There is a free ferry from outside Amsterdam Centraal Station to the pier on which the Botel is docked. These run like clockwork every half an hour. The Botel itself is clean and well presented (apart from the occasional worn sofa). A breakfast room, bar and lounge is available but we didn't really use these facilities so I can't comment. The rooms are small, but in my opinion, you only use the room for sleeping. They provide tea and coffee making facilities, as well as a TV. The bathrooms are small, but the showers are powerful. The walls are thinner than one would like, but not a big issue as our neighbors were quiet. As for the experience of staying on a boat, I loved it, my partner not so much. The only downside is that after a decent nights sleep, descending on dry land is a strange experience. It feels as if you're still on the boat and you mentally think you're rocking back and forth. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “for something different well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: This is not your normal run of the mill 3 star hotel, Yes it is a boat so it rocks a little, and you have a view of a wharf or a submarine and yes it is a little bit on the small side, but come on people is a boat hotel, its an easy 2 min walk to a free ferry to the city and after hours they put on a shuttle, The rooms despite there size had all we need, I mean come on who goes to amsterdam to spend all there time in there room? The room was fine, Clean and tidy The bed was large (or maybe the room was small so it just felt large) and not uncomfortable The shower had good preasure and was clean and tidy Breakfast was great with a selection of cold meats plus all the normal stuff, bacon eggs,toast etc Overall, uniquely worth it

Reviews.Title: “A very accommodating hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scottishgal5
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by how accommodating the hotel staff were! When I booked the hotel via the travel agents there were no double rooms available (our stay coincided with a dutch holiday) so I booked a twin room (booked it as a birthday present for my boyfriend and knew he would love staying in a botel). I then emailed the hotel and asked if it would be possible to actually stay in a double room and if possible have a room with a view of the water. When we arrived we found that we were staying in a double room with a water view - I was very impressed! Yes the room and bathroom are small but for the price you cant really complain and you also have the novelty of the hotel being on a boat. Breakfast was good and there was a nice spread of things to choose from. The ferry to the centre of Amsterdam was frequent and timetables were available from reception so you didnt really have to hang around waiting for it. A good budget hotel!

Reviews.Title: “terrible arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of a group tour. its basic and comfortable, small rooms as expected on a 'boat' hotel, tiny bathroom. but clean. breakfast was decent continental. not much to do around the location, u take a 30min ferry to city centre but ferries run frequently. staff, esp the asian lady was absolutely arrogant and terrible, would not stay at this hotel cos of her. when we got to the room, the soap dispenser in bathroom was not working, so i called reception and she came, said it was working. insisted, i said try it yrself, she did. it didnt work, then she said the nozzle was blocked and they ddint have any new one and left, no apology or resolution, fine, i can do with that. next day me and my partner came back to hotel earlier, so rooms hadnt been cleaned till then. the cleaning lady asked us if we wanted our rooms to be cleaned, we said is it possible to do it later, she said yes, so we agreed, later. then later in evening we went to reception desk and inquired abt cleaning staff, the arrogant lady said they have gone for the day. fine, i asked her since we didnt have our room cleaned, could we have some clean towels sent to the room. she said she will, we went out, came back no towels. this time when i went down to reception, there was a friendly man behind the counter, who was extremely nice and helpful, I requested couple of clean towels and he sent an entire set of like 4 bath toweks and 2 hand towels to our room immediately. so all in all, would not stay here cos of the arrogant staff memeber

Reviews.Title: “great stay the staff were helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: driverp
Reviews.Content: rooms basic but clean and modern...once we found ferry and got use to routine it really was 10mins from botel to dam square ...... staff were really lovely and very helpful.... breakfast served till 10.30 which was brilliant bread rolls ham cheese yoghurt cereal and even BACON SAUSAGE n eggs...... great stay all in all xx

Reviews.Title: “a basic but comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: emzc
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my daughter for a few days travelling from the UK. ive always wanted to visite 'anne franks house' and take a boat trip in this beautiful country, whilst educating my daughter about anne and the war years. we stayed in the botel and although quiet, found it clean and cosy. the only problem i found was that apart from reception, staff in the bar were not very friendly, perhaps not with tourists anyway. we ate out for food, although we did eat breakfast which was generous and plenty. we had a quiet stay, although our room was facing the barge and not the river front, which was beautiful at night. the bathroom was a bit poky, but pleasant all the same. overall a pleasant stay, and was only a short walking distance from central station which we found quite easily by ourselves. everything else was easy to find, and theres a local tourist office near the station where we were able to get tickets for the boat ride etc. i would definately stay here again, and am considering it for my next trip to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: spongebobBelfast
Reviews.Content: Just thought i had to leave this as the place seems to get a bit of a bad press on some other reviews. Location is a bit out of the way as you need the boat from amsterdam centraal to get to it, but it only takes 10 mins. Staff were very friendly, Joseph the night-porter was very helpful and very accomodating. Its not a luxury hotel, but great value for money and a little bit of a different experience than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully a balanced review of this unusual Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverfox1942
Reviews.Content: The Amstel Boatel website uses the word Luxurious to describe the accommodation. Luxurious IT IS NOT! This is a Budget Hotel in every sense of the word. Firstly the Bad News. The rooms are compact and the bathrooms are small to the point of tiny. The furnishings are minimal and the carpet is thin. The glasses are thin plastic ones and there is no tea/coffee making in the room. Our particular room had a shower with a broken fitting meaning that we had to hold the shower head with one hand while showering with the other! There was no plug in the sink and no bathroom fan so the place got very steamy at times. Now for the Good bits. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. The rooms are warm and the TV picture is good and has BBC2 and BBC world service programmes available. The breakfasts are adequate and the breakfast area is pleasant. The location is unusual and industrial but we found it interesting and not offputting. It was only a 5 minute walk from the free ferry that took you to the rear of the central station, which in turn was only a 10 minute ride. The ferry ran every 30 mins and was more frequent during the morning and evening rush hours. All in all as a lower price budget Hotel it is fit for the job, but please do not set your expectations by reading the brochure or web site, or you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Woohoo”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleS
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small but ok for overnight stay. Breakfast Buffet was very nicely stocked. Noises from an adjoining room were rather distracting during the night.

Reviews.Title: “No worries - this is a solid place”
Reviews.Author: Medium_Dane
Reviews.Content: I actually signed up on this page today because I feel the latter reviews are unfair - or at least not representative for our stay (which was 3 nights over new year's). No, this is not luxury - however it's solid and the staff was very friendly to us. The location worried me a little but if you do your homework eg. watch the video on the hotel website) beforehand, it's very simple. We actually came to appreciate the short boat trip to the central station when going into town. Only slightly annoying thing is if you just miss a boat (they go every 30th minute most of the day). I think a telling thing about the service of this place is that when we checked out we were asked whether we planned to take the boat, because it was not sailing (We never found out why). But in 5 minutes we had a free shuttle taxi to another boat (much closer to the central station - it's the one you are supposed to also take at nights). All this was explained carefully to us at check in. It's dead simple - and the boat is right next to the botel. Oh, and if you stay at the botel do drop in at the eating place next to it http://www.ijkantine.nl/index.php. We had dinner there the last night. It was great. At night it's like a restaurant with a splendid view. At day, however, it seemed there was a lot of noise and a lot of children... There really is little else than the botel and the kantine in the area, but I am not sure you need more. We did not. Amsterdam Central is just 10 minutes away. Having said that it seems that the NSDM-area is an uncoming one - as far as I understand there is also a metro line coming.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Botel”
Reviews.Author: faz28
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how comfortable and enjoyable my stay was. A Beautiful Botel with good facilities and extremely helpful staff. Special thanks to Joseph

Reviews.Title: “the Amstel Botel is terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: bellabellabella_9
Reviews.Content: We have visited many hotels in Amsterdam, but never have we visited a hotel wich is so poor as this Amstel Botel. The staff is not very friendly, the rooms are very very small, old and dirty, even the tv and the phone didn't work at all. We had many drunk tourists shouting all night. Because all of this we have left this terrible hotel in the night!

Reviews.Title: “The Amstel Botel is terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: bellabellabella_9
Reviews.Content: We have visited many hotels in Amsterdam, but never have we visited a hotel wich is so poor as this Amstel Botel. The staff is not very friendly, the rooms are very very small, old and dirty, even the tv and the phone didn't work at all. We had many drunk tourists shouting all night. Because all of this we have left this terrible hotel in the night!

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tigrisdea
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons why this hotel was not the best. 1. Lack of directions to get there. Out of the central station, there are about 4 ferries, one of which takes you to the Botel. None were marked with the name of the hotel to help us tourists and we weren't told when we booked. We had to call to ask, while on the pier. 2. It's quite far from the centre. Takes half an hour on the ferry. 3. You would really need to love the swaying. I didn't think I'd mind since I don't get seasick, but it got on the nerves (since travelling also includes a ferry ride...) and we were only there for 3 nights. 4. The food! The one time we were forced to eat there was when we first arrived and were starved to death. The burgers we had from the bar were dry and obviously microwaved or something. However the free breakfast was nice and had a wide selection. 5. Bathroom was pokey. 6. We weren't told when our room would be ready before we turned up. When we got there we were told we'd have to wait 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “There are pros and cons to staying at the Botel.....”
Reviews.Author: kittylitterbobcat
Reviews.Content: Having booked the Botel on the assumption that it was in it's old location, and based on older reviews, we were a little bit anxious to find it had moved and that more recent guests had been less than complimentary about it! The rooms are quite dated and shabby, but we found our room to be really clean- with the bedding and towels changed daily. The bed itself was really comfy, and though the bathroom was "compact", the shower was nice and powerful. The walls are thin, but we didn't get woken at all by other guests- and the Botel's location makes it quite peaceful at night. Plenty of English speaking TV channels should you want them, and VERY adult entertainment on Channel 50! The breakfast was perfectly adequate- usual continental type fayre plus bacon, sausages, boiled eggs etc. The bar serves drinks and light snacks, and there are also vending machines selling drinks and snacks just above reception. The staff were helpful, and there's a room for storing your luggage- should you arrive earlier than check-in or are flying out later than check out time. You now have to get a ferry over to the Botel (really easy to find at the back entrance of Central Station, last landing dock on the left as you walk out), the service is regular (every half hour I think), and takes only ten minutes. If you miss the last boat, you can take the night ferry over the river and a shuttle-bus picks you up for the Botel- we did this twice and the despite reservations, the shuttlebus was there both times! The ferry can either be a right pain or an enjoyable part of your break- depending on your perspective. We didn't really see it as a problem. If you're after luxury, this isn't the accomodation for you, but if you want somewhere cheap and clean- even if it may have seen better days-then don't be put off.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & cheerfull great for site seeing”
Reviews.Author: lordy509
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic , but clean. Small bar and lounge area internet, pool table thats about it. We found booking in easy and there is plenty of free parking near by (50yds) .Ferry takes you to train station incity centre 20min trip. Hotel has cafe's and bistro's 1min walk away. My partner and i found it ideal cheap rooms easy access to city centre ferry was free to use and ran all night and day. Breaffast was ok would not win awards but plenty was avaiable. Going back in 2010 for another fantastic weekend. Useing Botel again easy to find just far enough away to be peace full but close enough to enjoy Amsterdam nite life. if you like luxuary don't use it, it is basic

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cute”
Reviews.Author: KMJA
Reviews.Content: There's not a lot to say about the hotel. The position isn't that good but it's interesting to sleep in a boat. The rooms are small but clean, unfortunately we didn't have a great view. We just slept there, so we didn't see a lot, just the room. We paid too much for what we got, in my opinion, but at least our trip to Amsterdam was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away....what a dump”
Reviews.Author: DeltaPilot
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling all my life and this by far, was the worst hotel experience of my entire 47 year life. A complete rip off......on the edge of Amsterdam at some ship yard in disrepair. Too the ferry over to the NDSM Pier, right next to some abadnoned Russian relic submarine. Walked 5 mins to the floating hotel, and waited while they checked us in. Very rude front desk help. When we got to the rooms, I almost checked out.....it was that bad, but I was too tired to go find another place to stay. Could not fit on the toilet without moving sideways. If you fell down in the shower, you would land in the toilet or sink. Literally, the bathroom is smaller than a closet. No A/C, just a small window to slide open for fresh air. No inside ventilation to speak of. Prisoners at Guantanamo have better conditions. The bar was a joke and the on site restaurant had terrible food. The cafe at the end of the pier was extremely expensive. This should be called the Prison Barge Hotel. Spend your money elewhere......this place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Lowsy counter staff....”
Reviews.Author: kebabthief
Reviews.Content: Amstel Botel, what can I say? Cheap no frills hotel in a central location a few minutes boat ride from Amsterdam Central Station. We have been there twice now and knew what we were getting into as far as the hotel goes. Cheap, no frills and located well. Dissapointing though was one member of staff, an Asian lady who was very ignorant with ourselves and 2 other sets of customers that were there waiting to get sorted. Think she was having a bad day or sometihing, we all do but still no excuse for the behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - Botel Moored in Industrial Area”
Reviews.Author: Julie86
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Amstel Botel four times now and use it for an overnight stay on our way to Europe and then again on the way back to Britain. This is the first time we have stayed in its new moorings and I was a little disappointed as it, at first glance, did look to be moored in quite an industrial and "rough" looking area. However, we later found out that the "rough" looking area was Student Accomodation and we had no problems when we were there. There are a couple of bars close to the Botel, but no supermarket. We had to get onto the Ferry and go to Central Station to buy a few bits and pieces. The ferry crossing was a little tedious as we always seemed to have just missed a ferry so had to wait 20 or 30 minutes for the next one. However, the weather was beautiful so not a problem waiting in the sunshine, but I would think it would be a different story in mid Winter! The staff at the hotel were very good and the rooms are a little small but have the basics. Our shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. We paid Â£78 per night for central Amsterdam! Breakfast was extra which we did not take. Where could you get a room for that money minutes from the city centre. We love Amsterdam and would stay at the Botel again. Have no illusions about this floating hotel being romantic. It may sound as if it is, but it definately is not! The big plus point if you arrive by car is that there is plenty of FREE parking outside the hotel which is incedible for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “loved it had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: kellyajh
Reviews.Content: stayed at the botel in amsterdam. great value accomodation, great staff, breakfast was good, rooms clean and not a bad size for a cabin. we would definatley go again. read the reviews on here b4 i went and was a little worried about what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. have to catch a ferry across to the centre but they run constantly and are free and only take 10 mins to get across. overall had a cracking weekend and no complaints. would denfinatley go again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there in 2005 - worst experience of my life.”
Reviews.Author: Dexter543
Reviews.Content: although several years ago now and maybe thngs have improved, I feel compelled to share my experience of the Botel. I stayed in one of the lower deck rooms (the bottom of the window is about level with the water !). Unfortunately the septic tank must have been a slightly higher level than my bathroom, because every so often turds would appear in my toilet. Wasn't too impressed by the mould in the shower either.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: 55bloke
Reviews.Content: We booked the Botel as it was the cheapest accomodatin we could find, so we can hardly complain that it wasn't 4 star!! But, the rooms were VERY small, and VERY basic, and the walls extremely thin!! And, as has been mentioned, the whole place is loking a little tired. The Botel rocks in the wash of passing barges, but it's not a huge problem. We found the breakfast to be a little odd, but there's plenty of it. The staff were very helpful and friendly though. It took us a little while to find the ferry behind the station, and to figure out which of the half dozen or so running was the one that goes to the Botel- and that it's actually publuc transport, rather than specfically for the Botel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money and Plesant Service!”
Reviews.Author: blonde1001
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the rooms are small... VERY small!! But so what, if its a fancy, big hotel room, with fabulous amenities and a hotel that you can lounge by the pool all day that you're looking for then go somewhere else beside Amsterdam! All you need in this city is a bed and a roof and the Amstel Botel provides that and more! The bed was so comfortable after a long day of sightseeing and checking out the enterainmnet. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful, and to my surprise the towels were changed everyday. Breakfast was more than adequate and there was even a hot cooked selection. I would definately stay here again, the ferry ride across to Centraal Station was really plesant every morning, a nice wake up call, that fresh sea breeze!! So the views arent great and the place is a little tired looking, so what, this hotel was far better than I expected, and I would definatley recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, tired decor, chipboard bed... The Fab Botel”
Reviews.Author: fortyboohoo
Reviews.Content: I think this is the most difficult review I have ever compiled since this Hotel should be getting a rotten review for its tiny rooms, inconvenient location, poor decor, cheap furniture, and chipboard bed... But you know what... I loved it!!! Why? Well it was cheap... it advertised a rate of 80 euros/night, which is cheap for a continental capital city, but we got it for half that, a real cheap price... but more than that, much more... It had real character. Firstly... the tiny rooms... well this is a "hotel" which is in fact a boat... hence Botel. Stretched over several floors the rooms are not what one would call full height, make no mistake a 6 footer won't crash their head, but a little headroom saved on every floor no doubt allowed an extra floor of accommodation, so not only is the square footage small, but so is the CUBIC footage! Then there's the showeroom, this is definitely NOT a place to bring your cat, but the hot water from the shower had surprising quantity, pressure and heat... No it wasn't a power shower, but there's no denying it was a surprisingly good shower. The TV was an old fashioned portable, with a huge array of channels including a free streaming (or should that be "screaming"?) porn channel 24 hours a day (no parental control though so beware the kiddies). For those of you interested, and me and my partner certainly were as we'd come to enjoy Amsterdams famous cultural contribution to pleasures of the flesh, you'll find it at channel 24! The furniture was cheap, the bedlinen similar and the bedframe constructed from chipboard... yep every expense has been spared here... Although the mattress was in good condition and hence comfortable. The window was tiny, but then so was the room. The decor was tatty, the carpet repaired in one place with "duck tape" and frayed elsewhere. The whole place was clearly in decline... But... but... the Botel gently swayed, the view was of the harbour and the bed was a full sized double and comfortable... There was something distinctly likeable about this place. It could be its dreadful location... in an industrial, seemingly defunct part of Amsterdams port... yet, right next door to the Greenpeace ship, all decked out in its rainbow colours, opposite is an old soviet submarine, behind is an excellent and reasonably priced restaurant, "The Kantine"...
