And then there's the journey to and from the Botel, by free ferry running every 30 mins (From the Botel at on the hour and half hour, and from Centraal station on every quarter past and quarter to the hour). Easy peasy, a bracing 10 minute run across the harbour, a fantastic start and end to your sightseeing trips. In fact we experimented with a different ferry from The Botel and ended up at Amsterdams market, which is I hasten to add, huge and diverse, a wonderful experience of Dutch life. TO GET TO THE BOTEL from Centraal station... DO NOT USE A TAXI use the FREE FERRY... to reach it from Centraal station just exit the station following the ferry signs, once outside walk straight in front of you and cross the road... you'll now be at the waterfront, turn left and walk until you get to the ferries, you need the NDSM Werf, which is the last one of them. You'll see a sign above displaying the number of minutes to the next departure... in our experience the ferries ran dead on time throughtout the day. Note the ferry to NDSM Werf is not a 24 hour service and if you're after midnight you'll need to get a different ferry and then catch a free shuttlebus, so if you're planning a late night just speak to the staff at the Botel and they'll guide you. Amsterdam itself is less than 1 hour flight from Birmingham and the trains from the airport to Amsterdam Centraal are easily accessible and CHEAP. From Birmingham it takes me longer, and costs more to fly to my mates in Edinburgh than to the Botel, yet Amsterdam is such a world away from the UK!! Laughably, the Botel ( you may note I do note refer to it as a hotel... it would be a travesty to do so!) has 3 stars... Gawd knows which travel organisation awarded those... but there must be some trade description thing going on there. Even so, I really liked the place, it was a great place to put your head down, the ferry was a lovely way to start each day sightseeing. The Kantine was fab, and I will be returning, indeed we're already planning our next weekend in Amsterdam and we'll definitely be staying at the Botel!

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel but the new location is awful”
Reviews.Author: English_Frankie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had previously stayed at Botel two years ago, when it was only a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station. We didn't realise it had moved and the instructions said that it was now "opposite Centraal Station". We spent a good hour and a half driving around, trying to find it before we realised that opposite the station actually meant BEHIND the station and we had to catch a ferry to get there. This was really disappointing as the thing we liked most about it last time was its central location. The ferries only go every half an hour and you do waste time, what with waiting for a ferry and then spending 15 minutes on it to get to the hotel. We did have a car but none of the three people at the hotel that we asked had the faintest idea how to drive there from Amsterdam, which I thought was odd. The rooms are so-so. I noticed a few marks that looked like chocolate but could have been anything on the headboard of the bed. The bathroom is tiny and a bit like a pod. I am sure that the cups in the bathroom had already been used. On the plus side, the bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! The rocking motion of the boat made me feel as though I were drunk. I don't remember that at all from last time. All in all, it is ok, but not if you want a central hotel that is quick and easy to access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and service”
Reviews.Author: AngietScotland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this Hotel! Fantastic..As mentioned the free ferry was very efficient and you could be in the heart of the city in 10 mins..The hotel itself was very clean, the rooms small but very functional and the staff amazingly helpful. Breakfast was lovely and the bar prices reasonable..the atmosphere overall was great! The Hotel is docked directly accross from the Greenpeace ship Sirius, and we were invited on board for a look..There is a lovely cafe/winebar called the KANTINE it was also very good..around the corner from that and the 1st street on the left takes you too a very friendly Brasserie..but if you turn right at the MTV building you come accross a hippy commune and a brilliant friendly and relaxed pub called Noorderlicht ( Northern Lights) This is where all the locals go (even though it is in the middle of nowhere just passed the giant black crane!) Superb!! As for Amsterdam itself! There is a fantastic pub called The Old Highlander just up from the red light district staffed and visited by ex pat Scots! and it is again popular with the locals! Whatever you do don't miss a visit there! I would certainly have no hesitation in recommending this cheap and very cheerful hotel to everyone! We are already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cracking wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fachtna
Reviews.Content: This is a retrospective review, written mainly because we have used trip advisor heavily planning our latest trip and thought to update about the Amstel Botel First and foremost, dont get a taxi from the train station to the hotel. You will get fleeced by a very honest driver, who will drive the correct route and charge you the proper metered fare. OR, he could have told you to go out the back of the train station, get the free 10 minute, and thoroughly enjoyable, ferry ride direct to the hotel. You also get to pass an old Russian submarine on the ferry which was a surprise. Once the very nice taxi driver dropped us off at the hotel, we boarded the hotel. Boarded being the right word. Its an old converted ferry and it was very novel. the staff were magnificient and, much to my relief, spoke very good English. They told us all about the ferry, chuckled as I swore the taxi driver up and down and checked us in quickly and efficiently. We checked out the room and were quite surprised. The bed was a comfortable bed, the room was clean, the tv was free, had a kettle and all the makings for a brew. The only complaint about the room was the bathroom. the toilet was fine, clean etc, but it was more of a "head" in the naval sense than a bathroom. It was incredibly tiny. If you are a porker, watch out for that. The shower itself is also tiny, but suitable for one person and seemed to have an unending supply of hot water. Trust me, the woman tested that with the longest shower in history. Our more rotunf bretheren should probably avoid the bathroom. Either way, if you drop the soap, skinny or not, its an adventure to retrieve it. Towels were replaced daily by the cleaning staff who also gave the room a spruce, made the bed, emptied the bins etc etc. Dunno about the bedlinen change routine as were only there for 3 nights. Half a mile away from the town (via the ferry, which is free and half-hourly) its a cracking base to your holiday/break. The hotel itself it very quiet, even though we saw at least 3 stag parties when there we were undisturbed. Contrary to the literature we had read, it wasnt a solid base under the boat. It had been moved and was afloat, which turned out to be a bonus. The gentle lapping of the water as you drifted off and woke was lovely, as was the soothing rocking. Not enough to make you queasy, just a gentle rock. The restaurant itself was clean, and the food was varied. Along the lines of a mixed continental buffet. Usual cereals, variety of bread rolls/croissants, cooked breakfast and toast. As it was a buffet, those with no restraint had a field day. Yanks can sure pack it away. Yeee-ha. As we were there to check out the city rather than loiter around a hotel, cant say too much about facilities. The staff were more than happy to point out places to go and things to see, and couldnt give you enough of their time. No parking, but with the trams etc, no need for your own transport. For the price we paid, we expected a hovel but got a diamond. Rambled enough, just keep it in mind. If I go back to Amsterdam, this is a certain revisited hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cheerful, cheap option.”
Reviews.Author: buster1976
Reviews.Content: It seems from the reviews on here that people expect more from the Botel than it could possibly deliver. Rooms: We had a triple room. It was a little snug, but was warm and relatively comfortable. The mattress was a little thin and tired, but after a night out in Amsterdam, I slept very well indeed. The bathroom is comically small, but everything worked. It's all getting a little old, so expect marks and maybe some rust, but it was clean and the shower was powerful enough to wake me up! Location: the daytime ferry (until about 1am, depending on the day) goes from behind Centraal Station. The four little piers have a display board. If the display board has a number, that's how many minutes until the ferry. The daytime one is for NDSM Werf. It's free, easy and take between 7 and 10 minutes. I loved it. It takes you to the terminal 80 metres from the Botel. It runs every half an hour, and during rush-hour it's every 15 minutes. The evening ferry (runs all night, every 10 minutes) simply crosses the river, where a blue minibus takes you the 4-5 minutes to the Botel. It's all free, it works superbly and it means Centraal Station convenience. Our friends stayed in town and we were in town with them every morning with no effort. What does it matter where the boat is? To us, it didn't. It's in an industrial area (you can see it from Centraal Station ferry pier) next to a submarine. Service: The reception were helpful, if a little curt. We had no problems whatsoever. The exchange rate was the only sting in the tail! Other info: The windows get a little condensated, the boat sometimes rocks a tiny bit and the walls are thin (we heard next door have a marathon loving session!!). The TV has free movies and adult channels (so we were told...). There was a safe in the room. You can have as many door keys as you like. Some rooms smell a little smoky (ours didn't). Summary: Somewhere between a hostel and a hotel, the Amstel Botel was enormously convenient, quite cheap (we paid â‚¬40 per person per night) and did exactly what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: unhappy59
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Our family was booked to stay 2 nights and ended up staying 1. I think that since the Botel has moved to its new location it has gone downhill and is rundown and tired. It was like cheap student/backpacker accommodation The ferry service is good between the train station and the Botel, but the location is horrible. Industrial docklands â€“ bleak and stark with nothing around it . We knew we were staying on a boat but the rooms were very small and ordinary- cheap, vinyl/plastic â€“ extremely dated. A bathroom so small you could barely get in there!!! And it all just felt grotty! The bar area and dining room were very ordinary too â€“ cheap plastic furniture etc. It was probably alright to stay at when it was close to the train station because of its location. But now it has no redeeming features! For the price we were paying the quality should have been a lot higher.

Reviews.Title: “A boat too far”
Reviews.Author: Ricoshea
Reviews.Content: The Botel was fine once we found it. For some reason I though the ferry was a private one so took some time to figure out it was the public ferry with destination NDSM werf,after that it was easy. (It was 10pm &dark so I have some excuse!) The ferry while simple was too much of a hassel with a ferry every half hour it was not possible to just pop back to the hotel. The rooms were small but had all you need and clean, breakfast OK and a nice bar but I would not go again because of the distance from town.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: garlicScotland
Reviews.Content: Visited with a friend who had previously stayed a few years ago, we were disappointed with the position of Botel being away from main thouroughfare. Ferry was not a problem as the weather was very good but had it not been the distance would have been very inconvenient. The accommodation was extremely basic and cramped, had to move rooms as blocked drains had sewage flooding into bathroom. Breakfast was ok, nice fresh bread and rolls. Bar staff and cleaning staff were the most friendly. Will not stay again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: MJK54
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Our room overlooked the sea, and was very clean with a comfortable bed. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the bar man. Breakfast catered for all tastes, with plenty to choose from. Although the botel is located a little distance away from the central station (city area) we had no problem travelling to and fro as the ferries were running frequently and only took 10 minutes The shower is a little on the small side (not recommended for anyone over 5'8" or 12st), but again, very clean and well stocked with towels, etc. I would recommend a trip to Ikea as our pillows were a little on the lumpy side. I can recommend this hotel, and will certainly stay there again in the near future

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: dh141
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a couple of days in Amsterdam. Despite the boat having moved to over the water I throughly enjoyed the daily ferry trips to and from Amsterdam city center we did have great weather though might not have enjoyed it as much in bad weather, The boat itself is moored just a couple of minutes walk from getting off the ferry. It was quiet and the staff were very friendly and tolerate considering I was part of a party of 9 females celebrating a 40th birthday. The cabins were clean though a bit small. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have slept on. The shower/toilet was very small but clean and did the job. The small bar was ok the juke box was put on and the chairs withstood us dancing on them on our last night there. The bar could do with more variation of snacks all they served was cheese/ham toasties or a burger. The breakfast was great value with an assortment of food the little sausages were my favourate. Overall great price...not bad location....and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “warning dont go to amstel botel”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandElizabeth
Reviews.Content: my partner and i were booked on a three night stay at this hotel,we left after only one night. the hotel is reached by a 10 min ferry ride from the city station and you have to do this each time you want to come and go from hotel, the amstel botel is moored on what looks like a ship graveyard dumped out the way. thier is very little else around apart from one restaurant.the botel itself is out dated and drab,it is no way luxurious as described, the bedrooms are basic,with small wc/shower,our carpet was threadbare, and holes in the curtains.thier is a smell from people smoking weed, which about made us sick.the breakfast was poor and not well presented, the amstel botel is not suitable for many age groups due to its location alone, you really do feel you have been punished in some way be being offered this hotel please think again before you book.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all for the money. Happy to go back again soon”
Reviews.Author: Andi065
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Botel for a 4 night break with my girlfriend at the begining of September 2009. I chose it purely on the price and was not dissappointed. Luckily we both love boats so the ferry crossing was not a problem. Compared with land based hotels on the other side of the river this place really is good value for your money. (OK the word "luxury" on the side of the boat perhaps shouldn't be there.) When we arrived we were greeted by a really friendly receptionist who explained all that we needed to know about getting to and from Centraal Station at any time of day or night. The ferries are free, and so is the Botel's shuttle bus at night once the direct ferry has stopped. We never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for it. The room was exactly as it was described on the website, basic but clean and comfortable. Great view of a submarine from the window. The bar on the boat is fine, not over priced particularly and again friendly staff. Basically it's a fine place for a cheap stay, you get what you pay for in this life so if you want luxury accommodation go elsewhere, but if you want somewhere to get your head down, that's a bit different go to the Botel. There's a good restaurant / bar on the quayside too but it closes early in the evening (you have been warned). The only thing missing is tea & coffee facilities in the room, but you can always get the staf to make you one.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAponte
Reviews.Content: Reading the prior reviews within this website I had my concerns with our stay. But it was worth the money. Rooms are very clean , very very very small bath tiny tiny shower. Anyways you don't go to Amsterdam to stay in the room. Staff very very friendly and location once you get use to the itinerary of the ferry you could move around very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Botel - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: TonHoliday
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed, if I'm honest. The room was small and not particularly well equipped. The shower and toilet room was tiny - the sink overlaps the toilet pan and there's very little room to turn round in the shower. The carpet was threadbare, the ceiling was damaged and the tiling in the bathroom needed re-grouting. Well over-due for a make-over. I saw nothing to merit the advert on the side of the boat which said "luxury rooms from â‚¬84". There weren't even any tea or coffee making facilities. The Botel has moved from its original position and is now a 10-minute ferry ride up the river, so less than convenient for the night life. On the plus side, the ferries were free and run frequently. On the down side, if you miss one, it can be half an hour before the next one so you really need to plan your trip out. It's also not very convenient if you want to go back to get changed or if you forget to take something with you. I must admit that I'd been told it had moved but it wasn't clear exactly where it had moved to. Google Maps still show it in its original position. Considering I booked in January and paid Â£200 for two nights, I came away feeling ripped off. I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel. I wouldn't go again. The traveller photos on TripAdvisor.com are more indicative of the reality ... particularly the one called "the BotHell".

Reviews.Title: “My Feelings”
Reviews.Author: bintygirl
Reviews.Content: The Botel would have been better left on the canal. At the moment, the boat is on an estuary and there are many cruise ships, and cargo ships going by and the wash from those vessels make the botel rock all the time. Me and my boyfriend stayed at the botel from the end of july until 9th. august. It was very clean and the staff were helpful but it really could do with Tea and Coffee making machine in the room. It was awful waking up and not being able to have a cuppa. Breakfast was filling enough although mostly cold. The ferry was okay going to Central Station during the day but at night sometimes it was few and far between.The biggest hassle was having to make the trip into the city all the time and although the hotel was great, we wont be staying there again because of where it is and also, I was beginning to feel a little sea sickish the last two days because the boat never stopped moving.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Be In My Garage”
Reviews.Author: vegashoffy
Reviews.Content: Will never go back, and you should not go either. . The BOTEL moved to the north side of Amsterdam and is accessible by a ferry and should be a 2 star hotel, not a three. The rooms are way too small and the showers are made for elves. ! People come back at all times of the night drunk or stoned and it is hard to get a good night sleep. Their Website is misleading as well. Nothing at all to do around this boat at all! This is far from the center of Amsterdam. Dont be misled, go elsewhere! This is in an industrial part of the city, with nothing around to do at all.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning!!”
Reviews.Author: fencejumper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel 8,9 June, 2008. We arrived at 1300 and had to wait another hour for check in. We did go to the nearby restaurant which had good food. We checked into room 227. The shower did not drain, the front desk person did not care, but did offer to switch us to 235. No offer of assistance, no apologies, no compensation, etc. The rooms are small, but that is not a problem. Most staterooms on ships are the same size. They had lovely warm comforters on the bed, but it was 25 degrees C, so a sheet would have been nice. No top sheet on bed, just huge comforter. Then our confirmation stated breakfast included, but I did not have it printed out, silly me. They offered us breakfast at 10 euros per person, per night. Somehow, no breakfast is worth that much, especially since we were leaving too early the second day to even have had breakfast. The ferry takes about 10 minutes to get to the Centraal station, so it is rather inconvenient. Prices in Amsterdam are outrageously expensive, but no more Botel. Oh yes, the Private Spice channel was interesting................

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: jeffcavalier
Reviews.Content: The Botel takes around 25 mins to get to the main area of Amsterdam the ferry runs every 30 mins and are very reliable they stop around 12 45 most days , and avoid a taxi they charge 35 - 40 euro for the one way journey , you can call the hotel shuttle done just expect it to turn up at the allocated stop you need to ring the number on the bus stop notice board . The Botel itself is o.k. for the price , the rooms are small as you would expect the bar was quite and the breakfast was no very good the t/v had many channels to choose from, our bathroom quite often had a very severe smell from the drains and poor drainage in the shower , the staff are very pleasant overhauls I would not stay again mainly due to its location 1.5 hours a day wasted travelling to and from , but it quite good value for your money

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smudger0122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amstel Botel Amsterdam between the 23rd-26th March 2008. The Botel is easy to get to from the airport. On arrival at Schipol airport the train station is well signed and situated within the same building. You need the train to Centraal Station which cost 8.60 euros for two adults. Once you get to central station follow the ferry signs to the Nord(North)of the building. On exiting the Station the stand for the ferry is across the road and on the left nearest the bike racks. The destination board your looking for is signed (NDSM-WERF). This ferry takes ten minutes to cross to the botel and runs every fifteen minutes,until 7.45pm. Then every 30 minutes after. The Botel supplies boat timetables at reception. We were in room 341 which had a waterside/submarine view which was lovely. Our room was very basic,but clean and compact. The room had a small bathroom with sink and shower. Im of a small build but the shower was quite interesting,especially when the boat was moving!(Still moored) It was a tight fit but got you clean. The shower also had a shower gel/shampoo and conditioner dispenser on the wall. The room has a small wardrobe with few hangers and spare blankets in,there is also a radiator which keeps it nice and warm. There is no tea making facilities. Hairdryers can be rented at reception for a ten euro deposit,which you get back on return. The beds were comfortable but noisy especially when you moved in them. There was only two pillows and when we requested more,we did not get them. The towels were replaced every day when the rooms are cleaned. There is a TV with a few English channels including BBC1 and 2. People with children be careful about channel 31 (Adult channel)! The Botel has a bar area which serves hot and cold drinks also a small selection of snacks which consist of toasted sandwiches and burgers. The bar opens until 1am. The breakfast area was large and fully equipped with a constant supply of continental and english breakfast selection. In Summary the Botel was clean basic and a comfortable stay. The only problem we encountered is that you are quite secluded when you get back to the Botel in the evening. If you have'nt eaten in the main town before you come back to the Botel you are limited for options to eat. There is either a burger at the bar area on the Botel or eat at the Kantine restaraunt next door which is expensive and the service was extremely slow. We paid 75 euros for a two course meal for two including drinks. The menu hasn't much of a choice and I am not sure if they have a childrens menu. There were no children in the restaraunt when we ate in there. The food was nice when it finally arrived! But not worth the cost. Be aware: When we got to the train station to buy the tickets back to the airport, all the automatic ticket machines would not accept cash or credit cards. So we had to go and queue at the ticket office. Here you are given a ticket and wait for your number to be called. (Bit like argos) If you are running late this would hold you up as it gets busy. This may of been a problem with the ticket machines that day,but in case it wasn't it may be easier to buy your return tickets at the airport on arrival to save time. If visiting Anne Frank House, go early or late. Not in between as the queues are long.

Reviews.Title: “original but poor”
Reviews.Author: mik05
Reviews.Content: This floating hotel has decent rooms with very narrow bathroom; my room was not very clean, in particular the bath. During the night you can hear people shouting in the hallway and of course a very deep smell of cannabis. I didn't really like that one day, early in the morning, a staff's member suddenly broke into my room without knocking... The new position is not very close to the central station, so you have to take a ferry (20 mins.) to get there. If you are looking for a peaceful place to sleep, try another one!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: R_wee_country
Reviews.Content: Hey, I'm not sure what all the fuss is about, we picked this hotel on price and we got what we paid for. Dont get me wrong its not a palace but it was clean, tidy and warm and to be honest if you where expecting something grander then check how little you paid and think again. The rooms are basic but livable. The location is not that bad, the free public ferry leaves from behind central station and leaves you off about 150 metres from the Botel, cant see what all the crying was about. Lazy arses me thinks. The use of the mini bus for collection when returning home a little worse for wear in the early hours of the evening was hassle free. There is a very nice restaurant / bar situated at the end of the quay where the Botel is docked. Dont think anybody has mentioned that as yet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a damp, dark cold expensive room!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo_Goater
Reviews.Content: I wholeheartedly implore people to look elsewhere in Amsterdam for a hotel - as there are much nicer places to stay!! The last moment website we booked this through gives it an incredibly unrealistic 3 stars... We booked this on the recommendation of a friend who I can only imagine did not spend much time on the botel! I had paid Â£81 per night for 3 nights here, we ended up staying one and finding somewhere else at the first opportunity. The hotel is in a terrible location, way out of the city in an industrial estate, with ferries only crossing every half hour it could take you an hour to get into the city centre... the room we had was freezing, damp, the thin windows meant the gale that was blowing outside was also blowing inside, the "bathroom" reminded me of a toilet on a train (not one of those nice new trains either) When we then attempted to cancel our room the following morning, the reception staff were unhelpful and impolite, as we had booked through a website they would have nothing to do with us, we simply could not wait to get out of there

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Stayed Here A Great Experience But Would Stay Somewhere Else Next Time”
Reviews.Author: Trickletree
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay on the Botel having seen it years ago when I went with a Uni friend. Unfortunately the boat has moved which we only realised a week before we went but this shouldn't put you off as it is very easy to get the ferry across to the Botel and like another reviewer stated it does add to the holiday experience. My husband is a wheelchair user and we were a bit disappointed that there are two steps to get onto the pavement on the pier it is located but we managed to get him punted up. There is a ramp but he did need a hand to wheel up it because of the carpet that lines it. The life was fine but the room a bit small and his chair could only just make it into the room and was held captive by the door. There is a little step into the toilet which again is small but suited the husbands limited mobility perfectly. To be honest I had more trouble with the little step than him after a few glasses of wine. Must say on that note I had some of the best red wine I have ever had there ie Amsterdam. We were on the top floor looking out towards the train station and we both would find ourself transfixed to the view. I wasn't expecting to feel the boat move as much as it did but I really enjoyed this aspect as it is so unusual. The bar was good but got busy quickly and the decor could do with a bit more umf. We were a bit disappointed to be allocated a twin bedroom considering we were celebrating our anniversary. I enjoyed the breakfast, all the ingredient to make yourself a bacon roll which was nice to wake up to. We managed to walk to all the main attractions from this location as we didn't try the public transportation as we had enough hassle getting the train from the airport. You have to book assistance in advance or they make you wait hours which I think is ridiculous and unfair to the disables rights to travel spontaniously. The dutch are very easy going with somethings but very officious with others. All it all though we had a great holiday at the Botel.

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: bootilish
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel yes its moved but theres a free ferry and it only takes about 10 mins we would def stay here again the staff were friendly the room was basic but very very clean ask to stay on a high floor fab breakfast all included this hotel is a bargin it worked out at Â£22.00 per person per night including a great breakfast yes the bathroom is small but u get what u pay for we were over the moon 10 out 0f 10 we could not fault it

Reviews.Title: “Botel is not at all where it is advertised! Beware! Check my pictures”
Reviews.Author: MoominBristol
Reviews.Content: I always thought reviews were for moaners but please read this as I dont know how the Botel are getting away with their advertisement, the pictures you see are not where the boat is situated! Our weekend away was a christmas present from my Mum. She stayed in Amsterdam (although not on the botel) and said it was very central, however a couple of months before we were due to go we got an email and the boat had moved and apparently to a new trendy location! Please please check my pictures as to where the boat is situated, it is like an industrial site! There is a free boat to central Amsterdam but if you get a taxis then it will cost about 20-30euros depending where you are. The room we stayed in wasn't at all luxury like it states, its about a 1* but it is clean which is a plus. When we stayed there were large groups of lads which was fine but the corridors smell of weed! Amsterdam is lovely but I would reccommend a central hotel where things are walking distance as once we got up in the moring it would be a 2hr turnaround to catch the ferry back to the hotel and then get ready, chill and go back out for the evening, so once you leave you aren't going back till the end of the night!

Reviews.Title: “botel rocks”
Reviews.Author: marc68wales
Reviews.Content: First time to Amsterdam for me and was open minded about it, got to the hotel and to be honest i thought the ferry crossing gave a good sense of feel to the holiday. As for the hotel it self rooms were clean, beds were comfy and all staff were polite and helpfull. As for the bathroom yeah ok it was a little small but i have to say the shower was excellent. All in all i have to say i would definiatly book in here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting amsterdam. 30Jan - 3feb marc -s/wales

Reviews.Title: “Small and unique”
Reviews.Author: l0vebug
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Botel as part of a study abroad trip for a few days in 2006. It was a unique and fun experience. The only downside was that the bathrooms are TINY! No room to get ready. Take one step in there is the toilet and sink and one step to the left and there is the shower. The room I stayed in had what would be the equivalent to American twin beds, however, they were more narrow than American beds. Friends that had rooms that were double or more had larger beds and larger room to move about in the room. There was no TV in our room, was a working phone. They have breakfast every morning and a bar in the hotel. It is in a great location. Every room looks out onto the water. Our room looked out onto the canal and we were able to see boats passing by of all kinds, which was really great. We had an excellent view of the city and the hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to many of things, and if not to where you want to go it is close to a metro station. Service in the hotel was great. I'd be happy to answer any questions you have about the Botel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Davey1800
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been moved from it's previous location next to Amsterdam Centraal Station. The hotel now resides behind the train station across the water, about a mile away. To reach the hotel, exit the train station at the rear (not the front exit that faces Damrak), and turn left onto the main road. There you will see four ferry terminals together; go to the left one out of the four and every 25 minutes or so, a ferry will appear. The ferry terminal sign will say "NDSM" The ferry leaves Centraal and goes to the Botel at 15 minutes and 45 minutes past the hour. The ferry leaves the Botel on the hour and half hour, so time this right or you have a long wait for then next trip. There may be two ferries operational at peak times though, so wait times decrease. The last ferry leaves Centraal at 11.45pm. After that you have to ring the Botel up for them to arrange transport - not ideal really. Now, the hotel... It is a very well presented hotel, run efficiently and is generally very good. The rooms are smallish, with a very small toilet/shower area. The shower (in my room at least), was so small as to be very awkward to use. I'm only 6 feet tall as well, so not too big. There is ample storage space for the solo traveller, just enough for couples. A wardrobe and drawers are provided. There is a 14" TV in the room with a decent selection of English and Dutch channels, including the legendary 24 hour free hardcore porn channel. Great stuff! The windows open very wide, so you can let the sea breeze waft in. Also you can let the smell of weed out! My room stunk and took a day to smell ok, so bring a good air freshener with you if you don't smoke weed. The mattress on the bed was magnificent, I have never slept on such a comfortable bed in all my life. It was great and sorted my bad back out. The pictures on this website don't do the rooms justice in my opinion, as the rooms look dark, dingy and dank in the photo's. In reality they were great and kept clean by the efficient cleaners. The hotel reminds me of a Travelodge to be honest. Basic yet meeting all the required needs. The reception staff were very polite and helpful (typical Dutch behaviour) and answered my queries with ease. The reception also provide the lock for the roomsafe and charge â‚¬18 deposit, of which â‚¬15 is returned when you hand it back to them at the end of your stay. Reasonable, but it should be a free feature. The breakfast was good, with orange juice, tea, coffee, breads, pastries, meats etc.. laid on. I didn't try the bar or other mealtimes. Overall, this hotel is great and offers good value for money. However, due to it's location and thus the long travel times, it cannot be recommended, unless you don't mind losing 90+ minutes a day out of your schedule (this is four ferry trips per day, as well as the wait times).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and simple”
Reviews.Author: avfcandy
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quick and easy weekend in Amsterdam then this is the place to stay while your there. I understand that the Botel has been relocated since I stayed there but previously it was right next to the Central Station and only 10-15 minutes walk from the main areas of the city. I didn't get chance to try food at the hotel, the bar was basic but an ideal way to start a night out especially with the jukebox and friendly staff. The rooms aren't anything special but for the relatively low price you pay to stay there you get your money's worth. There was no problem with noise from other guests or people outside during my stay. The Botel also gave me the chance to experience staying on the top tier of a bunk bed for the first time since I was a child. Wide range of TV channels on offer in the room including a hard core porn channel (channel 31 in the room I stayed in) on all-day long (no surprise - it is Amsterdam after all) They also have a diverse range of guests - during my weekend stay I saw couples, groups of lads, travellers on their own and even families at the Botel. Finally when I told people back at home that I was stopping on a boat they said 'Wasn't it rocking all the time?'. Well no need to worry because the Botel is clamped on to steel girders and it's no different to stopping in a hotel on dry land.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a great stay”
Reviews.Author: jobbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again on the botel from dec 29th to 2nd january for new year. Had a great time again. OK the rooms are small but who the hell stays in your all day when in amsterdam. Great bar, staff great apart from one guy who is a bit miserable. It's only a 5 minute walk from central station & a 5 minute walk to the bars etc if you know the short cuts!! Never had the breakfast as i prefer a long lie and head out to a bar to get a decent breakie. A bit of a disapointment for me is the botel is moving on the 7th january to another spot over the water to north amsterdam which is a fair bit away so i'm a bit upset as this will be my last time here. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel - excellent”
Reviews.Author: redjockey
Reviews.Content: For the 5th time, we again stayed at the Amstel Botel. Although past it's best, this hotel is well worth the money - this time we got 3 nights for the price of 2 via hotel.connect. Ideal for Central Station - anyone who says its a 15 min walk needs to get a move on, it can't be above 5 minutes even for dawdlers. Easy to find your way back to after a night out; just head for Centraal Station and there it is, no wandering round identical endless Amsterdam streets looking for yours. Rooms very clean, although a bit dated, breakfast fine, eggs, bacon, toast, cereal -all anyone has at home, I'm sure! Staff are always very helpful, even let us check into our room at 9.30am (again) and a handy locked luggage room to leave your stuff in for that late flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zetenberg
Reviews.Content: Went to stay at the Boat with an open mind as i had read alot of negatives about it. We were very surprised when we arrived and really enjoyed our 3 nights there. We emailed them a few weeks before we went and asked for a top floor room with Canal view. This is what we had (room436). We would not have liked to stay the other side as there is alot of building work going on. The boat is moving in January tho. The room was small with 2 single beds but big enough for sleeping and getting ready in. Spotlessly clean and fresh towels daily. Breakfast was ok and plentiful. Small but cosy bar and ideal for a quick pint and game of pool before hitting the town! . The cheese and ham tosties are the best i have had !!!. I would book to stay on the boat anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: Plus Points; Convenient for Central Station Clean Comfortable Good size rooms Bathrooms clean and well appointed Helpful staff Free movies in room. Bar Negative Points; Overpriced? Very busy at weekends Breakfast and dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Cant see what all the moaning is for..............”
Reviews.Author: bevgem
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day this is a boat that has been converted into sleeping quarters, And all the staff have no problems in doing all they can to make your stay as comfortable as they possibly can. We had a twin room and the single beds are rather small but all you do is sleep in them and for a short while, because outside there is a whole new place to discover where as far as we found nobody judges anyone else in what they say or do. And to see so many smiles in one day or night is really pleasurable and makes a great change from seeing some of the Miserable faces that appear in the uk on a daily basis. The showers no you could not swing a cat in them but if you was in there with a cat then you need locking up. As said by other trippers the TV in the rooms have a 24 hr porn channel but as always there is the good old on and off button or even other channels to watch so the choice is yours. Breakfast not brilliant but edible, the hotel is very clean and a 3 to 4 minute walk from the Central Station. Great place (for couple of days away from rat race) will be going back after christmas.

Reviews.Title: “The Botel...it's not awful, but don't make it your first choice”
Reviews.Author: danielrice20
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place, but not great either. Amstel Botel had a decent location. The complimentary breakfast was slightly above average. The beds were fairly comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, exceeding my expectations to some degree. However, the price (considering how worn out our room was, and how tiny the bathroom was), make it difficult to perceive the value at this property. Also of note, the nearby construction can make sleeping past 8am difficult. There are better places to stay in Amsterdam, for less money. While I don't regret having stayed at the Botel, I would have difficulty recommending it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but OK if you don't expect much luxury”
Reviews.Author: Stropaire
Reviews.Content: OK place to stay. Rooms small but generally clean. Avoid lower deck, I stayed there once and the smell from the toilet was pretty dire -staff did not want to acknowledge this so it took much argueing to get them to move me to another cabin. All extras you pay for or pay a deposit. For example you will need to leave a deposit (refundable) for the key to the room safe. Breakfast OK but pricey unless you wnt to eat a lot. Then it is worth it. Allow ten-fifteen minutes to walk to Central Station and the Trams -more if you are carrying luggage. Bar very basic, but OK for a quick drink before going out of an evening or for a nightcap. Having said this I have often stayed there

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: born2critique
Reviews.Content: The Botel is an exciting 5 minute walk from the Central train station. Although there aren't any hills to climb-there is one street crossing which requires looking out for bike, trams, cars and bikes again! The hotel itself is what one would expect for the price in a major city-basic linens, beds, tv. Be sure to pay the extra 5 Euros for the canal view-much better than the construction on the other side. The evening staff were very helpful. However, when we checked into the hotel around 2p.m. the gentleman at check-in said that breakfast was an extra 10 Euros per person-I explained to him that the rate I booked on his website included breakfast and showed him the confirmation-he would not honor that. So we ate breakfast at a cute cafe by the railstation and only paid 8 Euros for 2 people for breakfast. Be warned that tour groups LOUDLY pass by the botel to eat at the chinese/indonesian restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairelo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed on the botel in June for 2 nights, next time we will def stay longer. We had a great holiday, the botel is close to everything, only a short walking distance and trams are close by as well. A little warning, watch out for trams and cycle bikes, we nearly got knocked over a few times, the people on the bikes ring there bell at you to move but arn't perpared to stop. Some people are put off this hotel because it is a boat, it may look like a boat but it doesn't move like one. The rooms are small but clean and functional. There is no air conditioning in the rooms, when we were staying it was about 30 degree but we were able to keep cool with the window open. We were on the bottom floor, not much of a view but we were able to watch the ducks float past. I read in a review that people complained about the smell of dope, but i didn't notice it. Overall we had a great holiday and will stay again next time

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dottie07
Reviews.Content: The botel has seen better days and the rooms are tiny, poorly appointed and you can hardly move in the shower rooms. A long hike from the station and all the attractions of Amsterdam. Breakfast average. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Johnr
Reviews.Content: I would describe it as cheap and cheerful. If you want to spend a couple of nights in Amsterdam for low cost it ok. I think some of the reviews are totaly out of order for the price you pay they are expecting a 5 star hotel for 2 star prices. The rooms are more like cabins as you may expect on a boat. It an easy walk to all parts of the city and it is quiet. There is a bar on board and basic breakfast. It a bit like a floating Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for What you pay.”
Reviews.Author: KittyMcCork
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed at the Amstel Botel for 2 nights in September. The rooms are basic but very clean and great value for money. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect only 5 min walk from Central Station and 10 min walk from city centre. So very close to everything yet the botel is on a nice quiet canal if you are somone looking for a nights sleep. The only thing about the hotel is the food they do have a breakfast area but besides that you will have to walk over to the city centre for even the small things like tea or coffee. If they hotel had a small menu it would be very handy. Other then that great little hotel. Kathy Ireland.....

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: ILoveToTravel33
Reviews.Content: Is very well located - 2 mins walk from central station - easy to get to dam square (about 5 mins walking) and red light district (also about 5 mins) . Would definately recommend for people wanting cheap accom in good location - the only down side is that the bathroom is tiny. Also we stayed water side so I don't know how much noise would be heard if you stayed roadside with all the roadworks, but we didn't hear it at all... Not 5* but perfect for a few nights and we were more than satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Ok”
Reviews.Author: Sunlover1234
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed, and still cannot complain, rooms were clean, (they did not smell of tobacco etc) Bathroom small but i'm 6ft 3" and could shower without any problems. The only thing i could moan about was the smell of cigarette smoke when eating breakfast - its a non smoking area, but right next to the lounge and the smoke smell tends to drift in through the connecting door. Great if you are on a budget, easy to find even after a long day/evening in the pubs!!?!?!

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: primy
Reviews.Content: this served the purpose we wanted which was a bed for a couple of nights for us to return to after a day of sight seeing .

Reviews.Title: “big hygiene issue - less than OK”
Reviews.Author: junk172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel for almost a week during IBC conference last week. First impression : the room was small, a floating tobacco smell, apparently clean. After one night, some of my colleagues reported water overflows in the tiny bathroom (shower problem) but even worth, after two nights, one of my colleague started itching and couldn't sleep for the remaining nights as he endured an intense itch. We are just back from Amsterdam and his doctor just told him he got "scabies", probably due to inefficient bed cleaning. Then, there's the very noisy environment of the Central Station. On the plus side? Breakfast included and OK. Friendly staff. So it's probably worth spending a few extra bucks and skip this "less then OK" Hotel

Reviews.Title: “clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: cheshirecat36
Reviews.Content: Loved the botel clean and basic. We stayed with a couple of friends celebrating my wifes 40th. She wanted to go somewhere to forget it then what better place than amsterdam. Bathroom very small just managed to squeeze my 6ft 4inch frame into the shower. Friendly reception staff. Breakfast basic but plenty of it good place to stay if you want a central location for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wesnsandy
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews prior to our arrival, we were filled with a little trepidation of our stay at the Amstel Botel. This was completely unfounded as we found the botel to be clean, tidy, the staff were very courtious and helpful. The room was a double and frankly very little smaller than the cabin which my wife and I shared on the P & O Arcadia last April where we paid well over Â£6000 pounds, albeit for 14 days and full board. The bar was excellent and friendly with very reasonable prices, considerably less than some of the bars in the city. All in all, for the money , we could find nothing to complain about and we finished our stay in Amsterdam by going next door to the Sea Palace restaurant for a fantastic meal. I can only conclude by saying that upon reading the reviews the most of the complaints about the botel were from Americans, need I say more!!

Reviews.Title: “Botel, OK”
Reviews.Author: EmpireWag
Reviews.Content: The Botel is only a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station and town which is very handy. Building works are going on right behind at the moment and you are likely to be woken up by the sound of a huge pile-driver at 7am. Overall the place is extremely basic but clean which is all you need. The bathroom is tiny, my husband is 6ft 6 and could not physically get into the shower. Using the toilet without cracking your arm on the sink is tricky and trying to reach the toilet paper requires a near contortionist manoevre. Breakfast is basic but sufficient and overall the place is a good, central, cheap choice although we would have stayed elsewhere had we not been in town for only 2 nights. Beware of leaving kids alone with the TV remote, the free porn channel is next to Nickelodeon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Botel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTony
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in the hotel, and we are generally very happy. It was nice to wake up in the mornings with the ducks outside our window. The room was well maintained and the breakfast was very nice. The only bad holiday experience we had was in a Mexican restaurant called "Guadalupe" across the road from the botel. The staff in the mexican restaurant were incredibly rude and told us we must pay for food we didn't even receive if not they would call the police. With the exception of the Mexican restaurant, we really enjoyed the break and the evenings on the botel, which we would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mikkaOttawa
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here I was nervous about our booking for July 07. I needn't have been. It was great. I still can't understand how our experience could have been so different from some of the other reviewers', except to assume that they thought they'd be staying in a higher-end place??? It's clean, it's simple, it's functional and it's comfortable (some of the best pillows I've found on our trip). We chose the bay side for both our room and our teen children's and it was probably a wise choice because it gives one something interesting to look at during down times (and is perhaps less noisy given the construction on the other side). We had little interaction with the front desk people and only had a brief visit to the bar (working men's club). No, it's not luxurious, but it had everything one needs for a comfortable (and clean) stay. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Dani
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the beginning of my trip to Amsterdam. It was such a terrible place that I canceled my last night's stay and booked myself at the Ibis for approximately the same price. Reasons why I didn't like the Botel: 1) The room smelled like stale smoke, though I think I requested a non-smoking room. 2) My room was right under the bar, so it was noisy until late. 3) The bathroom was ridiculously small - I'm a small person and hardly fit into the shower 4) The reservation website said that breakfast was included, but they wanted an extra 10 euro per day. 5) The room wasn't very clean, though the towels were (I think.)

Reviews.Title: “short break”
Reviews.Author: DOTTIESheffield
Reviews.Content: We had seen the Botel from a previous visit we wanted something different so we decided to give it a try it was great basic but good will certanley go back hotel was spotless staff very good Mr Mrs Yeomans & Mr & Mrs LATTIMER SHEFFILD

Reviews.Title: “Fine for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: richcaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Botel and overall it was fine for our requirements. It is handily located near the Central station and trams etc so easy to get around town. Staff were pleasant and friendly and there is a small bar. Rooms and bathroom were not large but were clean and the shower while a very small space did have good water pressure. The only real gripe with our stay was the noise from the building site on the dockside during weekdays (starting at 7am). Overall a good budget option

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: BennyTyneandWear
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel in 1996 with 7 friends and would highly recommend it for stag/hen do's or for groups of people/couples who do not care too much about their accommodation and prefer to get out and see things. I returned for one night in July with my husband and it didn't seem to have changed at all since then! That said, it is still fine for anyone who is more interested in seeing the sights than staying in a hotel room. Yes the rooms are small but presumably you only want to sleep and shower in your rooms and you can certainly do that. We may have been lucky but our room didn't smell at all. The bar is a bit smoky but just to the same extent as most of the other bars in Amsterdam. The breakfast buffet is a little limited (particularly for vegetarians - there is nothing hot available for veggies) but there is enough to keep you going. We found the staff to be really friendly and helpful and we were able to get into our room at about 10.30am. If you are going to stay here you may want to note that you can hire hairdryers at a charge, and also safety deposit boxes at a charge. All in all my opinion is probably along the lines of most other reviewers - it's okay for the price, the location is good, and if you can put up with the building work outside it's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: MOOSIEDorset
Reviews.Content: I wasnt expecting what i got to be honest, i found the reception staff friendly and efficient, there is a public telephone in the lobby with different dialling codes if you wished to phone home or check on the kids. the lobby and corridors were spotlessly clean as were the rooms. the rooms were very basic but you had a tv with 20 odd channels,some in english, the bathroom was very small but clean, you had a shower and clean towels which were changed daily, also every room comes with a safe,you pay an 18 euro deposit at reception for the key and you get 15 euros back when you check out. The location couldnt be better really,its just 5 mins walk from the central stn and within walking distance of many attractions and places of interest, bike hire, Dam square, Anne Franks house is about 20 mins walk, canal cruises just 10 mins away, it really is as good as you'll get location wise. One tiny moan is that our room was right above the bar and the bass from the music could be heard quite clearly, but the second night we didnt hear it once. There is also a wonderful chinese restaurant next door which is ideal if youve just arrived and cant be bothered to search for somewhere to eat. If your looking for a hotel in the centre of Amsterdam in walking distance to pretty much everywhere and its just 3 stops from the airport on the train and your not looking for luxury then i would recommend the botel. would i go back??? YES..

Reviews.Title: “A+ in location but falls short in overall value”
Reviews.Author: jsemi18872
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was nice because it was close to central station. I stayed on the canal side, which did have its charm and the staff was polite. However, the decor, small size room and tiny shower wore out its welcome. For the money, there are other options available and worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the location, not a 3* though.”
Reviews.Author: nottm_panther
Reviews.Content: OK, its a decent hotel for its location and proximity to the train station. That said it is not a 3* hotel. It seems that prices in Amsterdam continue to rocket and that is true of hotels more than anything. We paid â‚¬100 a night for twin rooms. In many other european cities â‚¬100 a night will get you moderate luxury but in AMsterdam it seems it will not get you much. On this basis you have to review the hotel for what it is, expensive but in a place where in proportion to other hotels it's in the lower band of hotels. Bathrooms are very small yet clean as are the rooms. We stayed at the end of May and it was 30 degrees for the 3 days we were there - the rooms have no air con and it was very hot. Breakfast was satisfactory and enough bread etc to soak up the previous night's intake of local alcoholic offerings. All in all it's an ok hotel, would I stay here again? only if absolutely necessary - ie stag where it was already booked / decided on. Certainly not one for the couple away for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Price good; otherwise.....”
Reviews.Author: VickyMcG
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is a VERY basic hotel room. The pro: good price as Amsterdam is expensive unless you go hostel. It is convenient; near the train, bikes, center. You feel safe, depending on who's staying there. There is a safe: you pay a small amt for. The brkfast is 10E; but very adequate, self serve with fruit, cereal, sandwich items, eggs, (soft boiled-overdone as always everywhere); coffee (tea etc), yogurt, bacon/sausage (bacon swimming in it's own fat). I was pleased overall with the brkfst. The staff was very nice/friendly. the cons: The room is very basic, bathroom: miniscule but you can get the job done-just don't stretch your arms out. The room was NOT clean; and in overall disrepair. No hairdryer in room, maybe they would loan you one. No amenities, but there is a soap/shampoo dispenser. They are now working outside and the huge pile driver wakes you up at 7 or 8 am. (wkdays only) Doesn't matter which side you're on, you hear it. It was very hot in the room so we had to leave the window open; inviting more noise; but it was pretty quiet except for the construction. The temp outside was about 60 during the day, 50 at night. It was hard to stay comfortable. Actually, the beds were okay and firm enough, yet yielding. We asked & received a couple of extra pillows-nice. On our floor we had a few "doobie tokers" (LOL) so it was rather...fragrant. Great for young folks who want to save some Euros, and YES, they clearly advertise that the brkfst is not included on their website. You have to pay up-front-that was different. Guess they expected people wouldn't like the morning wake up call! Cheers, Vicky.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay at the amster botel”
Reviews.Author: yasiyndle
Reviews.Content: hi booked with icelolly.com i came back last night !rooms very clean staff polite and very friendly.breakfast as good as any ive had in europe.the rooms may be compact but fits a bed in and very clean tiled shower and wc room, i stayed on the building site side of the river, but this was not a problem. after all you are not in the botel all day.I really cant fault this botel and will be going back again this year, this time taking my children,,,A1 on price and staff,( i must say i didnt know what to expect after reading reviews, thats why i wanted to say what I thought today after all if you want 5* then you have to pay for it )

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: theRabit
Reviews.Content: The Amstel Botel is a converted cruise ship drydocked right next to Centraal Station. For 89 euro per night, the city view is totally worth the price (but saving on the landview is okay too). Rooms & washrooms are clean and small, but cozy. We didn't get breakfast included, and it was expensive & about average - you can have a comparable breakfast on Damrak for cheaper. Close to Red Light, shopping, tour bus/boat stops and a 5-minute walk from Centraal Station.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible run down hotel”
Reviews.Author: dalyanne
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Amsterdam this morning, after a not so nice short break, at the so called 'Amstel Botel' hotel. We booked this hotel, as there weren't a whole pile of affordable accomodations available, and also, I liked the idea of staying on a boat hotel. Upon arrival, I was very disappointed. There were guests hanging out of the windows of the hotel, which is situated on a very dirty canal, with rubbish flowing all around it. Inside the hotel door, you are greeted with the 'stink' of horrible, disgusting stale and fresh ciggerette smoke (& I am a smoker). The bar, is boarding the breakfast room. It is very small, and not exactly 'easy on the eye'. The worst was yet to come - the bedroom: This room smellt the most horenduous. Stale smoke, dirty walls and ceilings, load noises from outside and inside the hotel, made sleep impossible, and the bathroom was only a couple of feet long - literally! My advice - DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Go for it !!”
Reviews.Author: ParkySomerset
Reviews.Content: Amstel Botel, Amsterdam Date. Returned 26 March 2007 Just had a wonderful weekend in Amsterdam, Amstel Botel very comfortable, ideal as so close to central station and city centre, no need to taxi or long walk to the canals, bars, etc. Accommodation very clean, bedroom adequate, shower a little small but hell its only for a few days. Staff very polite, breakfast was very good, bar a bit smokey but the Dutch tend to smoke anything so get used to it. Sited next to Sea Palace chinese restaurant which is a must for an evening meal, best chinese we have ever had. If you are thinging about using the Botel do it, excellent value for money, remember this is a capital city hotel, we paid about Â£ 78 per night inc. continential breakfast. Anth & Dave Parkin

Reviews.Title: “Bril Botel !!!”
Reviews.Author: grannychick
Reviews.Content: Sarah's Chick's On Tour March 23-26 We as a group of 15 stayed on the botel,it was bril the staff were plesant except the male barman,,,Joseph and the lady bar person were great.The rooms were cleaned EVERY day with clean towels every day also, its clean and the food was good,after reading some of the reviews you wonder what people want ,we only paid 71pds per double room per night with breakfast, they gave us the rooms we asked for,it was basic but great value for money, 5 mins from the station and 10 mins from the red light and dam square.If you are looking for a hotel with novelty value at a good price and close to every thing try the Amstel Botel,we would all go back

Reviews.Title: “Like a hostel, but with a bigger bed.”
Reviews.Author: DeWinter
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Botel is about a 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal Station, in the center of Amsterdam. As confusing as Amsterdam is to navigate, this place is very easy to find. You can't miss it, in fact. If you are interested in the quieter side of Amsterdam stay further out. But if you are interested in a night on the town and just a place to crash- this will do. The rooms are very very tiny, a king sized bed taking up the vast majority of space. The bathroom is even tinier. A sink, a toilet and a shower in a 5' sq. space. The shower is very cramped- having a raised floor and lowered ceiling, with barely enough room to turn around. The toliet is squished between the sink and shower. No ventilation in the loo, either. They offer no wash cloths. It is no smoking- and very serious about no drugs, hard or soft. Despite this, the hallways still smelt like marijuana. Very little street noise, but the floors and ceilings are thin- I was woken up both nights just by people walking up and down the halls. Get a room on the bay side, the other side is a mess of construction. Hearty breakfast (coffee, tea, juice, hard boiled eggs, toast, kippers, croissants, sliced meats and cheeses) if you are willing to pay 10 Euro for it. Nice bar area over looking the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience but generally good”
Reviews.Author: kirstytravel
Reviews.Content: The first thing that is important to note is that the situation of the botel is very convenient, as you exit the Amsterdam Centraal station the botel is a five minute walk on your left, very good when with heavy suitcases! It is also a nice distance from the centre of Amsterdam, a five or ten minute walk takes you to the action, not too far to walk and far enough out of the hustle and bustle of the town. The Botel is on a river near to the train line (although train noise didn't really pose a problem) and it is important to note at this point that when given the choice of two sides of the boat, pick the more expensive side!! We didn't and were faced with the view of a huge building site and the building started at around 7.30am in the morning, the noise of a massive piledriver every morning wasn't welcomed. This aside the experience with the Botel wa sfairly pleasant, the room was clean and spacious according to Amsterdam standards, the interior generally was clean and welcoming and the breakfast was extensive. We had become accustomed to European breakfasts and were expecting the same but the Botel breakfast had a fairly extensive range and filled us up significantly every morning which was even more delightful because it was free! There was also a bar open to 12.45am but we didn't visit because it did seem to be full of a 'butlins' style crowd every night. All in all we would stay at the Botel again, a pleasant and novel experience (after all it is a boat!) that, building site aside will be a pleasant addition to our holiday memories.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamTulips
Reviews.Content: Had a great time the boat is lovely and clean the staff are helpfull, not noisy at all, the bathroom is small but enough for you while you have your stay, nice white clean towels, i would state a canal view on 3rd or 4th floor . For the price we paid i cant fault the botel,

Reviews.Title: “Botel hotel”
Reviews.Author: broonieboy
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, a 5 minute walk from central station. Come out the door turn left and keep walking past tourist info and you will see the botel sign. Good location for trams and easily walkable to Dam square. As for the accomodation, it wasn't bad. It is basic, but you are only really there to sleep. Saying that, at times getting a kip can be a problem. A couple of things were a bit annoying including the overactive heating which made clunking noises all night and the noise of pissed and stoned guests coming back at 5am. Staff are helpful and having read other reviews I can say that there was no issue with the cleanliness of the rooms. Would i stay there again? Probably not, but i would recommend to friends on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “No Problem”
Reviews.Author: LadyG_DHQ
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Amsterdam - stayed at the Amstel Botel - had a lovely room on the top floor, overlooking the canal. Room was very clean with a nice view - bathroom a bit of nightmare, especially if you suffer with claustraphobia - staff OK - some need to exercise their face muscles and try smiling - Breakfast not up to much - food lukewarm, possibly cooked and then stored in a hotplate for quite awhile before it was served. Overall, good value for the price paid - it isn't a five star, but you are not paying five star prices! Ideal location, especially as our flight arrived in Amsterdam at 21.00 - The Botel is within walking distance of the Centraal station and easy to find - about 5 to 10 minutes walk. Would definitely stay there again, but don't think this would be the ideal place in summer when both the city and the Botel are busier as I don't think it would be as peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: Mels1
Reviews.Content: We found our room immaculately clean during our recent stay. Go for a canal view room if you don't want construction noise but avoid rooms under the bar and restaurant as sound proofing isn't brilliant. Bathrooms really are very tiny. Overall it's an ok place to stay but I wouldn't rush back as I think there are better places to stay in Amsterdam for similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “No Waves Here”
Reviews.Author: TDog258
Reviews.Content: The Botel is changing location, but not service. Room and halls were kept very clean. The rooms comfortable , with basic furniture. Staff was polite and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good starting point”
Reviews.Author: iano81
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to use as a base of operations in amsterdam. Clean, great location and not too expensive

Reviews.Title: “OK, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Derrywood
Reviews.Content: Booked stay between 15th to 17th October. Location good, close to Central Station (5 min) and City Centre/Dam Sq, (10-15 min). Rooms, (or cabins) clean and tidy, housekeeping very good, staff friendly, especially in bar. However, accommodation is basic and cramped, with little room between beds and dressing table! Toilet/shower room very tight for space. Location very noisy with continual trains passing and extensive construction sites nearby. Be aware when booking, most hotel search siites offered inclusive breakfast but booking through Botel's own 'availaibility & reservations' site does not provide this! It is mentioned in their 'rates' page at 10 euros. Be warned

Reviews.Title: “Other than the bedbugs......”
Reviews.Author: mikeinlamesa
Reviews.Content: Initially I had booked the Hotel Damrak but was put off by the reviews on this site concerning bedbugs there. At the last minute I switched to the Botel and just arrived home covered in red welts. The location was good, the room was pretty large in comparison to other Amsterdam hotels, and the breakfast was good, so if you dont mind the bedbugs biting, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “great value amstel”
Reviews.Author: lincolnuk1337
Reviews.Content: having spent many holidays in Amsterdam and different hotels,i have always wanted to stay at the botel,which we booked ,then we started to read the reports which left us to be just a bit worried. We are open minded people so we felt we had nothing to lose. On arrival it was only a 5min. walk from Central Station .On entering the botel we found the staff to be friendly and helpfull. Our cabin was on the top floor and on the side of the con struction work to my dismay. Being of a tender age i do suffer from tropical moments,and have to have the windows open all year round, we were not disturbed by the noise of any kind day or night. The cabin was clean. The shower room was a tad small 1 person at a time,Breakfast was substancial,we found nothing was to much trouble from the staff,All we can say is if you want 5star then you must pay the differance. We are looking forward to returning again in March and will stay at the botel again.Only this time it would have moved across the river,were thay will lay on a boat to transport you to the botel it may take longer then 5mins. th get into the centre of Amsterdam but it all adds to the fun of the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Freddy101
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - its right in the city centre next to the main railway station. Rooms are small but clean. There are no mini bar facilities but there is a bar in the hotel. You do get some noise from the train station during the evening and from a nearby building station during the day - but noise is an issue in most city centre hotels in Amsterdam. All in all a great base for exploring the city

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl54
Reviews.Content: After reading negative critics oft the Botel, we were pleasantly surprised!! The people were very friendly (Philp at the reception was very acommodating) Our rooms were small - but clean and the bathroom is very tiny but my 1,90 husband did just fine taking his shower. We had a canal view our friends had the land side - but there is noise on both sides! Construction on the land side and lots of noisy people going past on the canal side. The breakfast had hot and cold and was available from 7:30 - 10:30. Would I stay there again? Sure for the price - it was good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Budget”
Reviews.Author: Sioux22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam for 2 nights on our way home from the UK. I had read the reviews on here, good and bad and being on a budget decided we would risk it. It is in a handy location near Centraal Station, 10 minutes walk and handy to all the tours and shops. We got an indifferent greeting from the receptionist and went to our room on the construction site side. Yes it was as noisy as anticipated but bearable with earplugs. We turned down our beds (2 singles) and both found several dark hairs on our pillowcases. Gross!! They were clean just hairy. The bathroom was small but adequate and we chose to have our breakfasts in the city. We had a drink in the bar and the barman was barely civil so we left after our drink. We asked for a wake up call on our last morning in time for us to catch our plane but we didn't get it. Luckily we woke up in time and when questioned as we were checking out they admited they forgot but offered no apology. We left thinking how indifferent all the staff had seemed, perhaps that is the European way as we found it throughout Amsterdam. Maybe we just were unlucky. Would I recommend the Botel? Only to those on a limited budget. Would I stay there again? No, but then I wouldn't go to Amsterdam again as I found it a dirty hole.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Raahi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our Europe trip. Location is excellent especially if you are in Amsterdam only for a day or two. We were within a 5 minute walk to the Centraal Station which meant we were able to get a direct train connection from the Airport and walk to our hotel with our loaded backapcks. We were able to catch trams right in front of the station to do to the museums. And when we left we were able to catch our train to Berlin easily too. The view wasn't as great as I had imagined (canal view) but that maybe because we had a lower level room and the canal in the front ain't the prettiest one in the city. But we were minutes from the Dam square and the restaurants and night life. And yes, the shower cubicle is as small as a phone booth! But it had a sopa dispenser!

Reviews.Title: “Botel - Seven”
Reviews.Author: Kieran O
Reviews.Content: Hi, My wife and I stayed at the Botel this week - Oct 06. The room was ok, clean and tidy apart from the cigarette holes in the curtin. The bathroom is small, but ok. The bed, is advertised as queen size, but they fail to tell you that its two beds together, with a hard wooden area betweem each half. The staff were fine amd pleasent. The location of the hotel is excellent to the city centre. The breakfast is good with a choice of hot and cold. Overall, We would rate it 7 frm 10. Its good value overall.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make this place wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kazschofy
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star floating hotel next to centraal station. So the carpet is a little worn and the decor is a little dated, but its clean and functional and the staff are fantastic. So, you can't sleep with the window open as you're right next to the station. But get this right - you are RIGHT next to the station. You'll never loose your hotel, all the taxi drivers know where it is and you're right in the centre of town. The staff went out of their way to be friendly, chatty and helpful. The breakfast (although expensive at E10 - it wasn't as expensive as some!) was great. For a budget stay I would highly recommend this Botel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: lh4
Reviews.Content: No complaints about the Botel. Our room was fine although for me the bathroom was a little too small but apart from that you had everything you needed. Great atmosphere in the bar. Staff were nice and friendly. The construction work going on outside our window was only heard if you had the window open. If you're planning on seeing the city then this is a great place to stay as you're next to the station and central to a lot of the museums. Will definitely be going back on our next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - much too noisy”
Reviews.Author: QRZ
Reviews.Content: We booked in February asking for a non smoking room, if possible on the canal side. When we arrived, we were given a regular room, on the other side (the station side). We stayed there for 2 nights and it was hell. At the reception nobody wanted to know anything pretending the hotel was full. We didn't sleep at all, the noise of from the trains arriving in the station and from a construction site located just in front of the hotel was huge. The rooms are tiny as well as the bathrooms and the ventilation is bad. The breakfast was ok. Do not go to the breakfast room before 8 am or you will find the old bread and croissants from the day before.
