We payed the full price without knowing that a huge construction was in progress just a few meters from the hotel. We weren't informed by the reception and this is inacceptable. Our advice: try and find another hotel in Amsterdam, this one doesn't deserve a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: Jim Robinson
Reviews.Content: For what you pay the Botel is just fine. The rooms are decent and clean apart from the bathrooms which are tiny but adequate for an average sized person. The price was good for Amsterdam (70GBP/room/night). The location was very good being walkable to most of the major tourist attractions and only 5 minutes walk from Centraal Station making the transfer from Schiphol very straightforward (and cost effective). Our guidebook placed it in the top 10 budget hotels and if you go expecting a budget hotel you won't be disappointed. The only complaint we had was that the agency we booked it through (GTAHotels.com) advertised it as Bed & Breakfast (and emailed confirmation as such) but when we checked in we were told it was room only. GTA Hotels said it was a mistake and that we should be room only. As this was a problem with the agency the hotel staff, although friendly, were unwilling to help out and wouldn't ring the agency to enquire about it. Like I said, expect a budget hotel and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Me like.”
Reviews.Author: Ana54
Reviews.Content: The beds were a bit too hard, the room a bit too drafty, not enough hot water for everyone, and not enough pillows were placed in the room to begin with. When I first entered the bathroom, there was [-] in the bottom of the toilet outlet, barely visible but obviously there. Other than that the toilet was clean. But I liked it! It was clean, provided plenty of soap for both the sink and the shower, and had a wonderful breakfast with bacon, sausages, slices of cheese, cold cuts, eggs, French toast, syrup, orange juice, apple juice, coffee, I think tea, and I think there was other stuff; I might have forgotten something. The breakfast was included in the price. There were so many of us in my school group that some people got the canal view for no extra cost. There was enough room in the rooms to move around in. It's near a lot of hot spots. I recommend it; I give it a passing mark! The whole "boat" thing makes it somewhat unique. Nice lobby, nice restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “great base for amsterdam city”
Reviews.Author: bling-chick
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Amstel Botel - this is our 2nd stay this year in this hotel - making it 4 in total since last June. The rooms are on the small side - but as we knew we would be out sightseeing in the days and evening it really didn't bother us at all. We just needed somewhere to lay our weary heads at night!!! We stayed in room 316 and have always been lucky enough to be on the 3rd floor - do pay the extra for the canal-view. There is building work going on the other side and it really is not that much more for the canal side. You can sit at your window and watch all the cruise/party boats going by. Whilst we were there the weather was changeable - very sunny and very, very rainy!!! The rooms were warm - but no different to being at home with the windows closed!! My tip - leave the window open when you go out. No-one can get in through the window without a diving suit and a rope ladder!!! The beds are very firm...not uncomfortable firm though - do ask for more pillows as they are very flat. Had we known we could of requested and got more, we would have. There is a small TV in each room showing 40 channels - including BBC1, CNN, BBC NEWS, MTV, various music channel, Film 1 (showing movies constantly), dutch and french channels, porn channel - something for everyone. We never experienced any problems with the bar staff - we brought wine and beers from the local supermarket behind the Royal Palace (very cheap) and the bar staff were quite happy to give us cups of ice for the drinks at no charge. Upon arrival you pay for your room in advance - all over and done with, then you know exactly how much spending money you have left!! The breakfast was 10 euros and you really could eat as much as you liked. The location of the botel is fantastic - literally a 5 min walk from centraal train station and 10 mins (if that) to The Dam (main square in AMS), Damrak and the Red Light District and the flea market. We asked around at various other hotels in the area and they all averaged at about 100 euros per night. Some of these other properties did look slightly dubious - the reception areas were full of people 'smoking the green stuff'!!! Which is fine if you go into a coffeeshop (I can fully recommend Free Adam if you want to try one out - the owners are the most friendliest of people)....however if you want to sit and read the paper or relax in reception you don't necessarily want that going on around you. All in all - I would say that the Amstel Botel is a basic, clean hotel. If you want 5 star then book a 5 star hotel.......we are going back for New Years and would not hesitate in staying there again - in fact we have already booked and only been back home 2 days!! Amsterdam is a lovely city to visit and has alot more to offer than sex and coffeshops.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a lot and you won't be dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: bumblesquat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice with my partner and found it to be ok for what we paid, especially as breakfast was included in the price and there is a lot of choice including hot food. I didn't pay a lot either time and wasn't expecting too much so I wasn't dissappointed. There is certainly nothing special about this place but I have stayed in worse for the same sort of money so I would say as long as you look around to get a good price and you just want somewhere to put your head down it's fine. The shower/toilet room was very cramped and could definately do with some re-decoration as there's was mildew in the corners. The whole place would benefit from a refurbishment but no doubt the price would go up if that happens. The staff weren't over helpful or even really that friend either time but they do their job.

Reviews.Title: “The PITS! avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobNJulia
Reviews.Content: We arrived Sat 5th Aug and were on the 4th floor facing the canal, trains screeched past every 15 mins, construction site view was LOVELY! The room did have a decent sized bed but was very uncomfortable and the pillows were as flat as pancakes. The room was unbearably hot and stuffy, no air conditioning, had to leave window open constantly but then the noise of feet and drunks on the metal walkeway woke u up. Upon arrival there was grey hair on the carpet and the contents of somebodys comb dumped in the toilet! A horrible smell emulated from the shower drain. The shower was good if u liked a HOT OR COLD shower it was a skilled art trying to keep one hand on the hot tap to keep adjusting the temperature (bit hard to do when yer rinsing yer hair). The staff were not very friendly, no one said good morning when u went down for breakfast. This hotel is classed as 3 star! More like 1 star, we in the end checked out on Tues after 3 days and had to book into another hotel, i wasnt risking another dump so booked into a 5 star hotel, so all in all we paid for 1 week in the Botel and stayed 3 days, then paid for 4 days in a decent hotel so this has turned out to be a VERY expensive holiday! AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Better Before?”
Reviews.Author: tessaseaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Botel for 5 nights at the beginning of August. The location is very good, being only a short walk from the Centraal station, the Damrak etc. I chose it for the location, and also because I had been there before with my children, as a "budget" holiday. I also remembered it having the best hotel breakfast I'd ever had. Well, on a second visit it wasn't as good as I remembered, but then I'm older and more experienced now, so it's coloured by other hotels I've visited since. The room was still small, and the bathroom smaller, which didn't matter so much when I was younger, but is a bit of a problem when you get a bit less mobile. The bed was fine, but the view from the window was awful, being a building site, but I had been warned about this. One problem was the thinness of the walls, I could hear everything that was being said and done next door; not something that worried me with two children (we were probably the ones making the noise) but when I was on my own, it either woke me up or stopped me from getting to sleep. The breakfast was not as good as I remembered it, but my memory may be at fault. The staff were helpful and pleasant. Would I go back again? Yes, if I had children and was on a strict budget; no, as I think I deserve something a bit more luxurious now!

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: bcf
Reviews.Content: Dont stay at this place if at all possible. The staff are about as much use as a chocolate teapot! Not friendly and very un helpfull. Our room was on floor #2 had a lovely view of the building site and the screeching of trains outside our window every 15 mins throughout the night- not to mention the water pipes gushing out into the canal, and being delighted to see a digger going past my window (a few feet away) as I awoke form my 15 mins of sleep. We complained about the room and had and upgrade canal view! what a shame that we were situated on the bottom floor underneath the walk way and had to put up with the noisy footsteps of anyone walking past. The rooms are very small with a bathroom the size of a phone box. Although the rooms were clean, the breakfast isnt worth 3 euros let alone 10! Biggest downfall for me though was, that they will NOT allow cannabis to be smoked anywhere near the premises. Which is a 1st for me in visiting Amsterdam for 17 yrs. So anyone who wishes to stay here and like a smoke in the evening.... you have been warned, dont go to this place! A 1st and last for me to stay in this god awful place, Ive also spread the word to my friends and family that this place should be avoided at all costs! Blue cheese fan

Reviews.Title: “What can u say???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Problems: NO AIR CONDITIONING (rubbish for summer...!) - had to 'rent' fans (20euros deposit given back when fan given back) TINY BATHROOMS (okay they were cramped but bearable - no windows in them...) FLIES (general tip - do not keep light on and window open at night at the same time, attracts bite eating flies) SMELL ( general problem with amsterdam - that infamous smell of freshly smoked grass) Bonuses: LOCATION ( absolutely fantastic location - 5mins walk to central station which is where all roads lead to!) SIZE (rooms are a comfortable size but if u want privacy forget it!) Hope this helps in some way...I really liked the botel, not just for the idea of sleeping in a boat but because of the fact that it was pretty good value for money...just remember to ask for the canal view!

Reviews.Title: “Amstel Botel - Its Different !”
Reviews.Author: judithchalmers2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 1 night stay on the Amstel Botel . my 4th stay over an 8 year period . i stay here when i have an early flight back to the uk ... Its different ! Looks like a boat , designed like a boat , rooms like cabins on a ferry , small , functional and clean . ok its dos'nt float like a boat but it looks the part . You cannot beat the botels central position . 2 minute walk from central station , the red light district , the damrak etc . bus and trams on your doorstep . its not a cheap stay anymore Â£70 for a twin room - breakfasts steep at 10 euros a head but you can get a cheeses and ham toasty in the bar at 2.50 euors which suffices ! the triple rooms work out better value. to be honest you aint going to get a hotel much cheaper in the city centre - even the hostels are asking over 25 euoros a night for a bed in a mixed dorm ! bar prices ok on botel...but try and get your cold drinks for in your room from a supermarket as 1.80 for a bottle of water out the machine is a bit steep ! a tip ! stay outside amsterdam city centre - pumerand , volendam , edam etc . plenty of cheaper hotels ith great bus service in and out of the city - you can get a 4 star hotel twin room for Â£45 a night with breakfast . word of warning if you have kids with you and stay on the amstel botel be carefull changing over your tv channels as one is hard core porn ! great if your adults alone but try explaining granny lust to a 10 year old ! oh yes and like precvious reviewer said it was extremly hot - temp gauge said 38 in the lobby - no air conditionng but i slept ok with windows open - pay extra for room with canal view but ask for floor 2 and above as floor 1 has view obscured by gangplank . to be honest its an unusual place to stay - quite funky in a wierd 70's way - brilliant for the city centre and travel - central station etc but don't expect luxury and be aware that they eask for payment upfront on arrival ! 2 many scallies jumpin ship ! would stay again for convenience factor alone .

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ragga8
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed in the Botel from the 1st - 6th of july 06 and i had read about it before hand on the net and decided it looked quite good,I wasn't disapointed when we arrived however we were there during a heatwave and it was almost impossible to get asleep at nights as there was no air conditioning,when i asked at reception for a fan we were told there was none left so we basically had to like it or lump it.On the 2nd day we phoned reception to ask for an ironing board and iron to give our clothes the once over before we headed out on the town, 20 mins later..still no iron so rang reception again only to be told we had to go down to the front desk and collect the iron ourselves...not a major hassle as we weren't far from it but any other hotel ive stayed in brought stuff like irons to your room door! Breakfast is provided every morning and when you check in they gave us the option to pay for breakfast for the duration of our stay or to pay every morning as we arrived in the breakfast area,the food was very good and was 10 euros and u could eat as much as you want however stay away from the tea and coffee vending machine..i dont know what it was in it but it certainly didnt taste like tea!! Also i wouldnt recommend using the internet in the bar as it ate 2 euros on me and all i got was a blank screen,if you want to check your emails etc use the FREE computer in "the greenhouse effect' bar in town. But the Botel does have its good points..It is VERY close to central station (5mins walk max) and although the rooms are small thats only to be expected with a hotel of its type, the rooms were immaculate and one thing i liked was the fact that the maids didnt bother you until you hung the wee sign on the outside of your room door saying you wished it to be cleaned, the bathroom is tiny but the shower was brilliant and was plenty of towels with extra ones in the cupboard in the room and there was a remote controlled tv with at least 30 channels including a few english ones, bbc world..music channels etc. Another plus is the fact that there was a vending machine at the top of the stairs in the lobby with cans of heiniken in it (2 euros per can) and loads of soft drinks plus CANS of water and crisps etc. Over all i would have no hesitation in using the Amstel Botel again however if you are planning to stay there, and you think the weather is going to be warm i strongly recommend purchasing some type of travel-fan for using in the rooms at night because your chances of getting one off the hotel are slim. Please dont be put off staying in the Botel if you dont mind it being basic accomodation it is fine! If you have any questions or concerns about the botel email me and i'll try to help u.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: theswanguy
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable and clean. The location was Excellent, easy access to town, all of the major busses or the trai n station. This place was a great deal and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: chipss
Reviews.Content: I booked this Botel as it was cheap through lastminute.com, after paying for it I read the reviews on here, as was totally put off, so much so that I tried to cancel but couldn't. However, It was not too bad at all. I speak as someone who stays in lots of hotels around the world, 3* and above. Ok, the room was basic but comfortable, the bathroom tiny, can only fit in one person, but the shower was fab, lots of towels (you dont need to bring your own) like someone said. Good TV reception with 2 or 3 english speaking channels. Clean room, very safe, cleaners ecah day if you wish. I would rate this a good 2*, and afterall we wern't in the room for long, out all day & night, so it suited the purpose. Do ask for another pillow each though. The boat is on concrete as isn't actually floating, we requested a canal view, as you can see from the pics, there is a building in the process of being built on the other side, so we avoided that. The staff were very friendly we found and helpful. The breakfast is ok, lots to choose from. It is a 5 minute walk from the station and a 5 minute walk to everywhere ekse, can't fault the location. So please don't be put off as I was, it is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pooy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner in May 2006 - The weather was absolutely brilliant and the location of the hotel is brillian however, the rooms are veryv small and the bathrooms even smaller. No tea/coffee making facilities however, i had brought my own thankfully. The hotel advertises luxury rooms but when i asked about this i was told all the rooms are luxury - i don't know how. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for long stays as it is as basic as they come and quite costly but i still enjoyed my stay. Breakfast was excellent with much variety and continually topped up. Extra pillows were required and were delivered promptly when asked for and rooms were cleaned daily with loo roll topped up. English channels available on tv including bbc1 for those eastenders addicts and chill out evenings (if ya know what i mean!) Overall a pleasant stay however, i would look around next time to get somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good service at time of crisis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have already written a review of the Botel based on a previous stay. I decided to go back in March. Unfortunately, I lost my credit cards en route - probably at the airport. The receptionist could not have been more helpful in getting them cancelled, to the point of helping me with my Dutch over the phone while I spoke to Customer Services at Schiphol Airport. What could have been a very stressful situation was ameliorated by his friendliness and professionalism. When I got home a week later, new cards were waiting for me at my local sorting office. That's all!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: peacefinallyfor
Reviews.Content: I read a review on here to ask in advance for a room facing the canal and to be above level 2. Well we asked and we received ! We were in room number 316 and the view was wonderful as well as the lovely smell of Chinese food from our neighbours ! The bed was a double and very large indeed. Yes the room was small but you have to remember at the end of the day u are on a ship ! The shower was very poweful and in some cases too poweful. We had to stop showering now and again for the water to drain. When sat on the toilet u are touching the sink as well, but who cares ? not us ! On arrival the man at reception was not over friendly and we had to pay for the three nights in advance. Once in my bedroom I noticed only two pillows on the bed and went back down to reception to ask for some more. We went out for the evening and I was a little upset as they hadn't arrived and then there was a knock at the door and two more pillows ! In the stair well they have vending machines for soda, beer, crisps and snacks, but the bar on the ship stays open until 12.45am and also has a snooker table, pin ball machine, cd juke box and arcade games. The barmaid did inform us that we should tip her as well when she told us the price, which I thought was a little rude. The breakfast is not worth getting up for early if u have had a late night. Breads, cheese, funny bacon and weird tasting small saugages, with hard boiled eggs and a toaster to 'do-it-youself'. For drinks it was orange guice/apple juice/coffee. Don't even think about a good old cup of tea ! The t.v. is good and they have 24-7 great porn on it, as well as all the dutch stations. No air con in the room, so good idea to keep your window open when u go out in the evening. Its so safe as remember u are on a ship ! The view is wonderful and u can see all over Amsterdam from your window. I slept the three nights with ear plugs in and apparently my partner said he was only woken up once by late night party people. You need to take shampoo, soap and take your own towl, as theres are kinda thin. Also the loo paper is thin, so might be handy to take some tissues as well. At the end of the stay I did ask if the hotel could look after our bags as we had an afternoon flight back to the UK and we had to leave our rooms by 11am. We they took us to a very small room that was so full of bags on top of bags that it didn't look safe at all so we carried them around the town with us. This is the second time to Amsterdam and I will 110% want to go back to the botel and to be honest it made our holiday going there. How many times do u get to sleep on a ship ? Go give it a try and enjoy Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “No Probs.”
Reviews.Author: Debj1967
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Botel this morning and found the hotel to be fine, the rooms are very clean and we found the staff very helpful. We also had to wait for our room to be cleaned but we did arrive at 10.30 in the morning and it does tell you on their website that check in is after 2pm. The only down side is the rooms on one side of the hotel look on to a building site but thats not the hotels fault anyway most travellers just want a clean bed to get into after a day around Amsterdam. All We can say is that all in all its a great hotel with a good location close to the centre of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, noisy & poor room”
Reviews.Author: TonyP74
Reviews.Content: I booked a room around 2 months in advance. Paying the extra for a canal view. Upon arrival the canal view room was facing the canal for certain. Though this was all. They gave us the basement room that looks out to the water of the canal, the underside of the walkway complete with water pipes and the advantage of people being able to look into the room. This is what I was charged a premium for. In addition to this the room stank of cannabis, so this is Amsterdam, but I am sure the room could have been freshened. It was so bad I changed side of the boat (no other canal view rooms available), no view but higher. Well I say no view, there was the view of the railway line (plus the noise) and a construction site (plus the noise). During the process of this room change (around 20 mins) I saw 3 other guests also complaining about the same thing. To charge for a canal view is at best a damn right cheek, at worst a complete deception. The room itself is no way near the standard of a 3 star hotel that it claims to be. 1 star would be complementary. The bar is like walking into a cloud of smoke, no ventilation or air conditioning. Breakfast is not included and costs more than any of the nearby cafes which are far superior. The staff are not at all helpful. No managers were available. Unless you have low expectations I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Careful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well what can we say about staying at the "wonderful" Amstel Botel? If you look at all of the pictures of the Botel online then what you see in actual fact is a "glossed" up image of the establishment! Situated in the midst of a worksite (which doesn't seem to rest!) it is not very picturesque! - But then again most travellers haven't come to Amsterdam for the panoramic views have they!! When we arrived, we found out that our rooms were not ready as of yet, and to come back in 2 hours, or spend some time in the bar...which at 10.30am in the morning isn't really an option. When we arrived back at the check in desk two hours later, our rooms were still not ready! After complaining about this, we were told by the "helpful" reception staff that as we were not being helpful then they would not be... After a bit more "gentle" persuasion and pleading from us to they, they told us to sit in the bar and have a drink on them! (Again, after travelling from 4am in the morning, we were a bit tired, it was now 12.30pm!) When we eventually were let into our rooms, I can only say I was surprised by how well they are presented. We had a "doubleroom" which consisted of a large double bed, but with a thick piece of wood in the middle of it (think of 2 single beds joined together and you get the drift!)It was very clean though very basic. Don't believe the scary reveiews which say that there is no running hot/cold water as this is quite untrue...though watch out for the pressure in the shower...it is akin to a "jet washer!" The room is equipped with Television and satelite channels including free "Adult" programmes on channel 31! The breakfasts are also very nice with a large choice from Continental to Cooked, and to cereals. The Bar seems to be well equipped also, but don't beleive the closing times t night because Hotel guests are asked to leave half an hour before it closes so that the locals can use it...We were asked to leave by a rather intimitating he/she barmaid/barman. For the price, it is very adequete though the satff are quite rude and unco-operative....especially Steen!

Reviews.Title: “the botel is great.”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandRachel
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Amsterdam,this is for you. The location is excellent,2 minute walk from Central Station,10 mins from Dam Square. There is some building work going on behind the botel,however only during the day,quiet at night.Rooms are basic but clean and have a small en-suite with shower.Having talked to a few of the locals, many of the hotels in amsterdam have no private facilities!! This alone gives the botel an advantage.The breakfast is also pretty basic but caters for all tastes. Across the road from the botel is a brilliant mexican restaurant called the "Guadalupe", this is well worth a visit and is very handy if you are staying in the botel.

Reviews.Title: “awsome place!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights and cant beat it, awsome, friendly staff, great location. Would go again...

Reviews.Title: “NOT very good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed at the botel for 2 nights on the 3rd feb and it was abit of a disappointment, when we checked in we asked for a canal view and would pay extra if poss,he said no they were fully booked! so we had a room looking at a building site very noisey. we went for breakfast in the morning, stale bread and very little people in this fully booked botel,we come back late on satarday afternoon to find a cheeky invoice under the door saying we were charged 10euro less for our room and to pay it before you leave.. the room itself is ok the bed was big enough but two thin covers,the carpet was abit worn,the bathroom is small with dampness all over the ceiling,there are also no tea/coffee makers.we found the staff not very friendly and didnt seem bothered about us. the only plus point is your quite central, just watch your back i.e. bikes, buses, trams, cars and people etc. hoped this helps>>>>>

Reviews.Title: “the love boat:)”
Reviews.Author: salutkitty
Reviews.Content: just back from staying in the botel and it has to be praised! granted the rooms are not going to leave you week at the knees but for â‚¬78 for a double room including breakfast for 2 people, that is great! location is quite good, myseLf and my friend did get a taxi home (although the taxi man tried to over charge us by 10 euro, but we sorted it out!:) ahmmmmmm, if yiou do get a landview though the building works are vv noisey! but other from that great hotel and the staff are lovely, receptionist and bar maid were both lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfried and I just returned from a weekend away at the Botel (3 nights) and we loved it! It is a fantastic location, you can walk everywhere. We were in Amsterdam in March 05 and we stayed miles away in an expensive hotel and it cost a fortune for taxis. The room was really clean, warm and the bed was comfortable. The staff clean the rooms everyday and bring fresh towels etc. If the porn channel isn't your thing there are loads of other channels (at least twenty). The Bathroom is small but not tiny it does the job. We didn't hear any noisy and the staff were pleasant and helpful. I can't comment on food because we didn't eat there but the Bar was nice and inexpensive. It is also very safe and secure at night. After reading some of the reviews on this site I was worried but need not have been. This is a great place to stay, really different for your normal hotel. Oh and the view from our front room was beautiful and there is the most amazing chinese restaurant next to the hotel. We would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful botel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Onat
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Amstel Botel three nights. We just returned from our trip. I was extremely pleased with the accommodations. The botel is in a perfect location, a 5 minute walk from the central train station, within walking distance to one of the main streets in Amsterdam (Damrak), to the canal rides, to the red light district, gay neighborhood, and many coffee shops. I had requested a quiet room with a view and they had let me know that they were going to do their best. Surely, they did. We had a wonderful view of the canal and historic buildings. Our room was quiet and clean. The bathroom was a little small, but it was completely managable. The X-rated movie channel was fun. The breakfast was included in the relatively low price of the room (75 Euros on a week day, 85 Euros on the weekend) and it was delicious. The rooms were warm and you could adjust the heat (we were there in the middle of January). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us city maps, provided us with directions to where to make phone calls, take the tram, etc. If I had to complain, I would only complain about the unfriendly bar tender. Unlike the hotels in the US, it is not common for hotels in Europe to have ice machines. My boyfriend and I wanted to have some cocktails before venturing out into the nightlife (we wanted to save money, Amsterdam IS expensive) and we asked her for ice. She gave us the weirdest look and almost was rude giving us the ice. Other than that, everything was perfect. The staff really did their best to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. When I read the reviews here, I was a little hesitant and worried, but I realized that my worries were unfounded. I must say, however, we were there during the off season (middle of January), it might be a different story in the summer. However, my experience was great and I recommend Amstel Botel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle&Hol
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with 2 other friends. Both rooms were very clean, with everything you needed. (Along with the free porn channels!!) The breakfast was good and plenty of it. Nice friendly reception and bar staff was refreshing. We also used the complimentary room to leave our luggage on our last day as we only travelled home late that night. The location was superb, just a very short walk from the train station and 5 minutes from the Red Light District. For the price of this hotel, you can't really complain. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the ducks quacking very early in the morning!!! (That'll teach us to stay out too late!). Would deffo stay again. Michelle - Wigan, England

Reviews.Title: “Botel is Great”
Reviews.Author: OEKiwis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel during Xmas and it was great. Good value for money, the rooms and hotel are clean, nice breakfast, friendly staff, excellent location. Cant fault it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveling_mom_Boston
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was a bit worried. I stayed here for 5 nights with my 2 kids age 5 and 8. It was suppose to rain all 5 days and it was the 1st time my daughter was without the stroller. I needed a hotel close to public transportation. This fit the bill. Central station was a stone throw away and we could get busses, trams, and trains very easily. The kids LOVED it. We had a triple and I thought there was plenty of space. Remember - this is a boat. I expected everything to be smaller, but it wasn't. The shower was tight but I've been in much smaller ones. Only one night did we hear anything and it wasn't that loud. We had a room on the 3rd floor - I would recommend 3rd or 4th. I was worried about the porn on the TV but they turned it off without me asking them. We also had 2 or 3 English kids stations to keep the little ones entertained while getting ready in the morning. I would recommend the Botel for families and groups. If you're there with a spouse there are plenty of other small hotels. Amsterdam is great with kids especially Nemo and Tun Fun. The Van Gogh musuem has a wonderful free pamphlet for kids - searching for art, puzzles, etc. 5 days was not enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location: Husband & I went for a long weekend break. The location of the Botel is great. Get off the plane, hop on a train & then walk the short distance to the Botel - perfect. Hubby had stayed there on two other occasions so hence the return trip to the Botel. Its very near the red-light district and a very short distance to the main area where you can pick up the canal tour boats. There are fab restaurants very nearby, so I can't comment on the food at the Botel as we did not eat there. Though we did have a few nightcaps in the bar - again fine. The rooms are not hugh, we got on ok and we are both big people (width & height). Its a boat at the end of the day, so some head ducking for tall people is required. Yep, ok the showers are small, but it did the job. We used the Botel as a base for our sightseeing, it therefore met with out criteria. It was clean, very warm and we did not notice the noise from other rooms - guess it was due to the constant exercise through sightseeing, excellant food & fresh air. We will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel last week. We had two rooms one double and one triple. The double room had a dirty toilet filled with **** , honestly !!. The triple room had a single bed and two bunk beds leaving very small room to unpack luggages etc etc. The rooms are very small , the walls are very thin any being very close to the central station , trains are heard all the time !!. Breakfast was decent , staff not so friendly tough eg: barman didnt want to make us a cup of hot water. Avoid it .

Reviews.Title: “Right next to Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a central, clean, bright and reasonbly priced accomodation, this is the one for you. The Botel is simple, spotless and right on the door step of everything. I went in October of this year and all 8 of us had a fantastic time, and we are all in our 40,s and 50,s. We paid Â£62.00 per night but that was sharing, so we each paid Â£31.00 per night, which I think is pretty reasonable. If 8 women between the ages of 40 and 50 can enjoy it, then everyone will. Enjoy your break !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special & Definitley not recommended for tall people”
Reviews.Author: Nazju
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel after travelling from Brussels. To our surprise they had no water supply so we had to wait till the evening to take a shower. We were put in a 3rd floor room which was ok but we had the view at the back of the boat, this consisted of overflowing drainage & construction work. The breakfast was really basic & nothing special. Luckily for us, we asked for a room change & got it. A strange thing happened while we were changing rooms. My partner left a bag in the room & i left a cleanser. When we realised, we enquired at the reception & she told that nothing was left in the room. Bet the cleansers really enjoyed my $60 cleanser! The rooms are really small & compact, not to mention the showers!! I wouldnt recommended to anyone. Its not worth the money, staying in a hostel would be less costly and you'll get the same thing!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable, but canal view?!?”
Reviews.Author: Maggie001
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Botel after a 3 night stay. We stayed there before almost 4 years ago and enjoyed it, and it was better than I remembered! It appears to have been turned round 180 degrees (I don't think I'm imagining it, I don't even touch the dope :-) and the person who said it doesn't float - explain that then!!) Anyway, the metal walkway is a new addition because of this and is one gripe I have. We paid extra for a canal view room, and were put on the first floor, which would have been fine apart from the fact we couldn't see (or hear) anything but the walkway, so what a rip-off that was! Was looking forward to the view we had last time, especially at night. They shouldn't advertise the first floor rooms as canal view. Apart from that, the place is spotless, beds are very comfortable and the shower is powerful and plenty of hot water. Yes the walls are very thin and we did have our very own live sex show (well the audio version) at 2am, but they got a nice waking up from our alarm at 8am so think we were quits :-) Don't expect peace and quiet! The bar was great for a couple of drinks when you get back if you're early, maybe it could shut a little later (closes 12.45am) but then again it would be even noisier wouldn't it. If you're bothered by the 5-10 minutes into town, catch the tram (you can buy a 48 hour ticket for 10 euros which is good if you plan to do loads of sightseeing) All in all, pretty good value and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “no consideration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very average with some problems that need to be considered before you book the hotel. 1 You have to pay up front even before you see your room then try to get anything changed or attended to, you will find it hard. 2 Hope you get good neighbours who will have consideration for other people when they return to the hotel in the early hours of the morning. The walls are so thin and flexable they do not kill any noise. Again when you complain you get negative feedback and very little help. 3 The bathrooms are all in need of very big facelift. They are moldy and smell unpleasant. I don,t think I would stay at the Botel if I returned to Amsterdam and I would say you should consider very carefully if it is the sort of hotel you want. All I would say it would suit a stag or hen party then they could make all the noise they want and everyone would be in the same boat (pardon the pun)

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, yet needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: gregsticle
Reviews.Content: Came here for my Girlfriends Birthday on a city break. Enjoyed the location - easy walking distance to Amsterdam's "interesting" nightlife. Yes the rooms are small and could do with a facelift, but they are clean & tidy and the free in-room porn channel was an unexpected bonus! Can recommend the floating Chinese next door to the Botel - fantastic food and views. Overall, good cheap(ish) accomodation in a wonderful city that is a change from the usual hotel one might stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September it was my first time in Amsterdam and after reading all of the reviews I did not know what to expect. We found the Amstel a great location, very clean, which I think is one of the most important things and great value for money. The staff were very helpful. We would not hesitate to stay here again. We did not have any complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic to explore the city you are very close to the Red Light District. The hotel is very clean and despite previous reviews i have read i could smell no dope at all. Also i found the staff very helpful and always eager to order a pizza in for you. The rooms are average for this price of hotel but are clean and well presented, yes the bathroom is small but your on holiday you don't need to spend hours in there! Breakfast was good value and with it lasting until 10:30 you don't need to rush to get up. I personally thought the beer and bar prices were expensive much cheaper to go to the supermarket. I will definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Amstel Botel-a good introduction to Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: WandMMcIlroy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Amstel Botel for the past 3 years in a row. Our latest visit was last early March,during the blizzard. Apart from having to haul our luggage(4 heavy bags)through the snow from the train station to the botel,we had a ball.We found the rooms although tiny, clean and the bed was very comfortable. We have always stayed on the 2nd or 3rd floor overlooking the canal. The view of the city,particularly at night was wonderful. Yes the walls are thin and the aroma of pot is always present(this is after all Amsterdam). These minor irritations have never preventing us from enjoying the atmosphere. Buffet breakfast(all you can eat) was fine, and we found front desk staff and the mgr. owner himself to be very friendly and polite as was the night desk man.We could stay in a 4 star hotel if we wanted to,but we find the Amstel Botel to be a great introduction to this fabulous city. The bar is also quite adequate but on the expensive side. Should we return to Amsterdam and we probably will,we will no doubt stay at the Amstel Botel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: TCHOW
Reviews.Content: First and foremost...For the high season the rates are great! Okay the positives. Very clean. asked for a non smoking and it really was a non smoking, smelled great.You have your own bathroom with a kick-ass shower. Location is awesome. Free porn! Bar in house with restaurant. Now for the negatives. Staff is not all that friendly, they were never rude it was just that they were not there to make your stay just a little more enjoyable with say even a smile or a good morning that would have been nice. The first floor should not have rooms on it due to the fact that above oh say...room 128 the bar is there and the floors are very thin and you feel and hear everyone bound for the bar or the restaurant or their 2nd floor room walking. very loud. Also we faced towards the city which is located next to the the boardwalk to the hotel and the chinese place and a 1000 other shortcuts and it is very LOUD. whats that you say? Close your window, well cannot since no airconditioning so all I am saying is that it is loud. Also on the first floor people walking by get a straight shot into the room this of course made it hard to enjoy the porn. Curtains were the type that were just about 4 inches to small so always some spot open. and the hotel is nice enough to put a bench for people to sit on right outside the door which puts it outside our window and we were lucky to get every young Brit in town drunk and loud and telling of all his conquests in the red light district which sort of made up for the porn intrusion. BOTTOM line good hotel, great price. My wife and I would stay again just ask for a room up high and on the back side where the construction is taking place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: Although I am a frequent visitor to Amsterdam I normally stay in a B&B more in town.However this was my wife's first trip to the city so I wanted something a bit different. Some friends of mine had previously stayed in the Botel and said it was O.K. however I did have some reservations after reading mixed reviews. I knew the hotel was in a good location being just a stones throw away from centraal station. So after researching a few booking websites (hotels.nl was by far the best deal) I took the plunge. First and formost you must try and get a canal view room which we had.But the problem was it was on the 1st (lower) floor looking at the walkway outside which was a little disappointing as it spoiled the view, but it was still better than looking at the building site and railway on the other side. Our room was a nice size considering this was a boat and the bed was queen size too and very comfortable. And yes, the toilet/shower room is very tiny. If you are 6ft 3ins like me it is a awkward. I was nearly breaking my ribs as I sat on the loo as the sink overlaps the toilet pan!!!! The shower itself was good and powerful. Indeed, the walls are on the thin side and for one night only we had a group of students next door that stayed up chatting and laughing until 4 in the morning. The restuarant was very nice with a good breakfast selection in the morning. The bar and lounge area was quite cosy as well, with pool table,internet access, juke box, pinball table and T.V. My only (and other guests) grumble was it closed too early. I found all the staff most helpful and pleasant. I do have just one other grumble which has been mentioned by other reviewers and that's the smell of dope that often drifts around the corridors especially when you return to the hotel from a night out. Personally I can't stand the stench and I feel the management should stamp it out. Smoking dope should be confined to the coffee bars and other bars of the red light district. On the whole we had a very pleasant stay.The hotel is in a great location and we found it offered very good value for money. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: birdseye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in mid May. Hotel was in a good, central location and easy to find. Managed to get a canal side room which offered lovely views. Room was ok in size but very clean. Bathroom fairly small but had a very powerful shower. Hotel bar was good, which cheapish beer and the breakfast was substantial. All in all, I would stay here again and would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “great base to explore amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the amstel botel 14/16 may2005,i was with a group of ten (five couples)we arrived early sat morning and was checked in by friendly staff,although our rooms would not be ready until 2.00pm we could leave luggage in reception.we headed to amsterdam and was advised to collect room keys after 2.00pm.the accomadation was of good quality,bed,tv,bathroom some of our party did moan about the small bathroom but it is a boat so what do you expect.the breakfast was buffet style,bacon sauages,boiled eggs,croissants,toast,ham cheese etc.and it was served until 10.30 which was good if you have been out all night.i found the bed really comfy and would go back again,wasnt too bothered about a dockside view as i only slept in the room,the tv did show free porn if thats your cup of tea? had a brilliant time and would advise anyone to book here .

Reviews.Title: “clean, cheap accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is expensive. this is a cheap, well located option. do not expect huge amounts of room though. it is clean and has a good bar . the staff are helpful. the interent connection was broken whilst i was there which was a bit annoying. we had a room on the train side, which was a bit noisy. i would ask for the water side. not bad for location -right near central station, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: MarcosSix
Reviews.Content: I agree with a lot of what have been written here about the Botel. It's a good, not great location. The rooms really need some urgent renovation. Besides the decoration being ugly, there are lots of stains at the walls and ceiling, speacially in the tiny bathroom. Not pleasant, but bearable. The breakfast was good and the staff very friendly. The lobby offers a nice cooffe bar with jukebox, pool table, darts, internet and is an interesting place to hang around while resting between rides through the town. The best feature for me and my wife, although, was that our room was almost at the level of the canal water. A complete duck family (male, female and 3 little ducks) seem to live around and got close to us looking for food. We just needed to open the window and make some duck-like noise, and there they came. If you love animals, that may be something to miss about afterwards. If they completely renovate their rooms and bathrooms, we will be glad to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “At home on the Botel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was curious about the botel after seeing some unpleasant views on here but luckily we found them to be unfounded. Please remember this was a river cruiser and therefore the rooms are small for hotels although bigger than i was led to believe from the reviews. The Bathrooms were small tho but we were expecting that. The room was very clean and the bed was queen / king size so plenty of room. We had a canal side room on the 1st floor. The view was spoiled by the walkway and meant that people could see into the room if the light was on but we just closed the curtains when privacy was required. Its location close to the central station and within minutes of the city centre is difficult to beat. Being on the water meant that street noise was minimal. It is true that the walls of the cabins are thin but this wasnt too much of a problem. We didnt sample the bar or facilities there so cant comment on them but there is definately a dope-smokey type smell across most of the ship (and indeed amsterdam itself). We hope the photos will give some idea of the botel as we enjoyed the stay especially as it seems at a budget price and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: dddane
Reviews.Content: Very average as far as a hotel itself goes.... The biggest upset was the grungy TINY bathrooms (I've seen larger porta-potties). The bathroom starts to really stink when you shower, not suprising since the toilet is basically in the shower). If you can get past this, the hotel is OK for the price. We thought we'd stay there cause it seemed unique, it wasn't really any cheaper than anything else we looked at, though... If you want something more "safe" and "clean" don't stay here... you can find a hundred other comparable hotels for the same price. The location is about a block away from central station.. very convenient as far as that goes. its not convenient if you want to walk outside and go to a bar or something, everything will be a 4 block walk...

Reviews.Title: “amsterdam continues to be a great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From Jim, Dundee, Scotland. Visited Amsterdam again from 13-16 April 2005, and stayed at the Botel which is approximately 3-4 minutes walk from Centraal Railway Station. This is a good and very clean floating tourist hotel and with its central location you can access all the major attractions by tram or by foot . The Botel does not take children. The free channels on the Satelite TV will probably explain why, but then again individuals have the option to watch or turn off. Anyway Amsterdam is so vibrant most people only want to use their rooms for crashing out in after the excesses of the day and night and only the extremely sad would want to stay in and watch TV. The cafe bars are something else and the general atmosphere in the city is one of being totally chilled out. Restaurants are freely available to suit any price range. My personal favourite is the Ankara, a good quality Turkish Restaurant with excellent food at very reasonable prices. My wife and I have visited Amsterdam 6 times in the past 5 years and will doubtless return next year.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend r only back from amsterdam on friday. we stayed at the amstel botel. i thought it was very nice accomodation yes it is basic but its very nice. the only thing i didnt enjoy about amsterdam was that it was a blizzard the snow is a half meter deep and i nearly broke my neck i wasnt prepared for this i thought it would hav been nice weather. so if there is any1 goin soon b prepared wif ur winter clothes as it is freezing its actually been snowing ther for the past 2 months. the rooms r small but its a boat and its only Â£54 a night so wat do u expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and generally great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I felt I needed to write something because of all the strange, bad reviews this place has got. I've stayed there a few times and am about to go back there for a 3 night stay on Saturday - hence me looking at recent reviews For what you pay, the Botel is great. The rooms aren't massive and the bathroom is quite small but everything is clean and tidy and the novelty of staying on a boat cannot be underestimated. You MUST stay on the canal side of the boat. There's nothing wrong with the harbour side but to open your curtains each morning to see and hear the water is brilliant. Not to mention that fact that you can look over the city; especially great if it's a weekday and you can watch people hurrying off to work before you take the short walk into the city centre for a nice smoke. Speaking of which they don't 'allow' you to smoke weed in the rooms but they don't do anything to stop you either. All in all, a great hotel and really friendly staff. Clean rooms and very good value fo rmoney. While sometimes people may get bad service off a member of staff who may have had a bad day or maybe a mistake is made and a room isnâ€™t cleaned, 99% of the time the place is great â€“ go and see for yourselves. You wonâ€™t regret it. I will post again when I get home after Tuesday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are TINY, the bathrooms are MINISCULE and the rooms do smell a bit smokey! But I found the Botel to be generally clean, friendly and in a great location! If you are expecting a huge, airy hotel room you will be disappointed but if you just want somewhere to shower and sleep, right in the heart of Amsterdam, then this is ideal! I don't understand the reviewers who said it was too far out of the centre! Perhaps they would rather stay right in the Liedsplein with all the noise and tacky pubs?? I have been to Amsterdam several times and I consider the city centre perimeters to stretch at least as far as the Botel! You can walk anywhere in the city from here. The nearest pubs and restaurants are perhaps 2 minutes away, with the red light district a bit further. If you are flying to Amsterdam, get on the train from the airport, get off at Centraal Station and after 5 minutes walk you are at the Botel! One thing though - we paid extra for a canal view but our window was right above the metal walkway which leads to reception. This was pretty noisy when anyone with heels clattered past so I would stay on the other side if I went back again! You can pay extra for the breakfast, and although it's a good spread, you can eat better for less if you go to one of the cafes on the way into town.

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: Westchase72
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the desk people and satisfied with the room. Coming back late at night can be a bit indimidating due to the long, relatively isolated walk to the "pier thingy". My only complaint was with the microscopic restroom, in which one has to virtually squat sideways under the sink in order to use the toilet. The shower was quite rusted, and the tiny bathroom quickly turns to a sauna when showering. But after all, this IS an old converted cruise ship of some sort. I was a bit surprised to turn on the TV and find XXX porn playing 24 hours a day, but I suppose that could be a bonus. Might not want to leave the kids unattended, though, if you're the sort that brings children to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent right next to Centraal Station. The rooms are small but clean Breakfast is adequate Free Porn channel for those interested. To sum up it is what it is a cheap hotel at a cheap price. If you want a luxorious hotel pay more and get one if you just want a nice clean cheap room in an excellent location. This is for you.

Reviews.Title: “botel : Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: jonathon10000
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and tidy as was our room. Bathroom was a little small but it is a boat remember. We could feed the ducks from the window, and there is a free telly in each room. All in all we had a good stay and would book again. Breakfast was bacon and sausage sandwiches and various rolls cheese etc.. .The botel is just a short walk away from the station and nightlife. There is building work going on behind the botel which did not effect us as we were at the front. JOHN

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the botel, clean, friendly and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, My girlfriend and I have just arrived back from a long weekend in Amsterdam. We had an excellent time which was compounded by two things, firstly the Amstel Botel and secondly the weather! We chose the Botel because I had stayed there 7 years ago when I visited A'dam with a friend. I couldn't remember much about it other than there was nothing bad about the place which is the sort of thing you don't forget too quickly. After a disgusting stay at The ACCA Hotel in February 2004 (don't go there whatever you do) we wanted to stay somewhere clean, friendly and close to the action. I decided the Botel was the place for us and what a great decision I made. The place was welcoming, friendly, clean and tidy. We received excellent service from all the staff, the breakfast was good, the room was very clean and bedding and towels were changed daily if you hung the cleaning card on your door, if you don't do that you probably won't get clean sheets etc which possibly explains a few of the bad reviews about the Botel. There was no major noise to report and the bathroom though small was exceptionally clean. The bed was comfy enough for three nights and the view over the canal was fantastic to say the least. We were on the top floor which made everything just perfect as when the sun shines over the canal the view is lovely. The rooms are small but what do people really expect, if you want the Mariott then pay for it. I knew from the moment we walked in and my girlfriend gave it the seal of approval saying "I really like it, its great" that everything was gonna be fine. That coming from anyone is not a really bold statement I suppose but as she is a Reservations Supervisor for a very large and expensive 4 star UK Hotel Group I think it says a helluva lot for the Botel. All in all we couldn't really fault the place, I would, without exception, recommend it to anyone. We were very, very happy and completely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “botel was fine!”
Reviews.Author: kaz1957
Reviews.Content: Well we got back from amsterdam about an hour ago and wonder if we went to the same botel as half the reviews on here???? we worried for ages b4 we went, but it was absolutely fine! IMMACULATE throughout! yes rooms are on the small side...IT IS A BOAT!!!!! but by no means tiny? comfy beds / bar served till 12.45am too!/ staff fine! and breakfast excellent, what more could anyone want? i would recommend this botel to anyone, for all the above reasons, plus it's good location to everything, most amsterdam hotels are on the small side anyway! and this was EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY! dont be put off!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dont go here if you want the ususal hotel amenities, couldnt get a drink at the bar after 11.15 and furthermore was insulted by the "bar person" when asking for one! Noise all night and the room wasnt cleaned in the 3 days we were there

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect. Very pleasantly surprised. Room exactly what was required. Staff very cheerful and helpful. Perfect location. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Blitzed on the Botel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the Botel very convenient for all the main sites and "attractions". Rooms were basic but clean. Had no problems whatsoever with the staff, in fact hardly saw any staff. In house movies were easily accessed ( Channel 35 in our room) and certainly set you up for the attractions. Breakfast was more than adequate ( eat and drink as much as you like)- we didn`t pay supplements for anything. All in all a basic , clean base if you are staying a hazy couple of days in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest rip of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I decided to take a few days in Amsterdam, so after checking out some guidebook reviews, I booked us at the Amstel Botel for 2 nights. The pictures made it look really nice and clean - but we were to find out otherwise. After trying to check in, an ordeal in which the concierge accused me of credit card fraud repeatedly, which entailed my having to walk back up to centraal station to use the ATM and pay for the room in cash, we were given our keys. The room didn't look terrible at first glance - just a bit small. Then we noticed the holes in the curtains, the stains on the walls, the dank, unclean little bathroom with a very suspicious shower, and stains all over our towels!! We wanted to take a nap, but the sheets looked like they hadn't been changed and as though one could catch lice from them, and the bedspreads were cheap and scratchy. We also noticed on our first evening that people were looking through the windows and seeing everything we were doing! Our first "breakfast buffet" there proved to be disgusting, with just cold cuts and some old looking cheese, and having to pay an absurd amount for any extra beverage, like juice. The staff, for the duration of the trip, was exceptionally rude to us, and refused to answer any questions. This is not including, however, the night clerk, an older Indian man, who was VERY friendly and helpful - the only nice person working at the Botel! As for safety : My friend and I went out late at night and came back late at night, and were always wary of what we called, "The Rape Trail" - the long, isolated metal pathway along the side of the Botel (a note to girls staying alone : be very careful around this area, we were approached many times by creepy older men around the entrance to the botel's pier thing) On the upside, the botel itself had good security. We had to use our keys to open the hotel doors after a certain hour, and when I brought a friend back into my room, the very nice night clerk politely told him that only Botel guests were allowed into the hotel As for the view : the back side of the ship faced a massive industrial site with a garbage truck, where they are construction the "Ode to Amsterdam", and a pungent aroma rose over the whole hotel - not to mention the strange noises that began at around 8am and woke us up While the botel is easy to get to and find, it is somewhat removed from the center of town, so if you want to check out nightlife, it's definitely not a good place to stay one more thing : never saw any sign of the "free in -house movies" so proudly advertised on the side of the Botel All in all - I would NOT reccomend the Botel - there are much cleaner facilities for what you pay for, and the charm of staying on a boat is massively overshadowed by how dirty the hotel is, and how rude it's (daytime) staff is

Reviews.Title: “Staff was helpful”
Reviews.Author: stoas
Reviews.Content: Our overnight flight from the US arrived in Amsterdam at 5 am, so we arrived at the Botel before 7 am, fully expecting to have to stash our luggage and wander about in a daze until the 2 pm check-in time. So we were surprised and delighted that the staff let us have our room at 7 am........a first in my experience. As others have mentioned, the rooms are small (but so are a lot of European hotel rooms-- get used to it.) They are very clean, and I never had any noise problems from my neighbors. The canal-side rooms do have a better view, but cost more. They also expose you to the noise of everyone walking on the dock that runs alongside the boat. The land-side rooms face a huge consruction project that looks like it will go on for a few years. All in all, I was happy with our stay. Very good location; just walk out of the Centraal Station, turn left, walk two blocks, and you will see the boat.

Reviews.Title: “The Botel is Good!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam twice and stayed at the Botel once. I am thinking of going back again and I will choose to stay at the Botel again. The other hotel I stayed at - I had to carry my luggage (a lot) up the stairs into the hotel (it was a 3 or 4 star hotel) myself. No one helped. At least at the Botel there was a ramp to take your luggage up. It is a busy place but very friendly and you cannot beat the location. Right by the train station and across the street from a "coffee shop". Everyone was friendly and I fed seagulls french fries from my window. It has atmosphere!! Can't wait to go back again. The price was right. Although the rooms are small - they are clean and "do-able". I am not a kid - 57 - but I like this place!

Reviews.Title: “Pay more for the water view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, it fails to match up to what I would call a 3-star hotel, but I guess all over europe the star rating system is a little off from what we have here in the USA. If you're looking at hostels, put this one in the mix. It is priced accordingly, too, as it is cheaper than many hostels available in Amsterdam. You definitley get what you pay for here. The rooms were very clean, and I found the staff to be quite friendly. No service problems or anything like that. The internet in the hotel has its on and off moments. There's a convenient cigarette vending machine and soda machine that accept only coin fare. The bar sells candy, and after hours, the reception desk takes on the candy selling responsibilities. The rooms were very tiny, and the bathroom was the bare minimum in size. Queen beds are really just 2 twins pushed together. There is a hard space in between. Couples are actually better just opting for the twin beds cause you get what seems to be a little more room and a center little tabletop area. Really, romance isn't one of the qualities Botel has to offer. The beds, however, are pretty comfortable. There is a desk and small closet with a safe as well. Television has the basics, including MTV, and 24 hour dutch porn (just channels away from the cartoon stations during the morning and afternoon-so watch out for your kids). We had the non-water view, which was one of the loudest and least comforting views I've ever experienced from a hotel room. The noise of the trains arriving and departing from very nearby Central Station combined with the sound of shoveling and huge construction machinery becomes almost unbearable by 2:00AM, and from what I understand, the sound isn't much more muffled from the front of Botel. However, the view is 200% better when facing the water. This cannot be stressed more. Added to the sound of construction and trains are the sounds of the other guests in the nearby rooms. The walls are paper thin and one can make out quite clearly the conversations of neighbors. Be advised. The location was great. Close to central station (literally next door), and a 10 minute walk to Dam Square. Basic jist - If you're a light sleeper, don't stay here. If you're looking for a decent clean, and semi-comfortable room in a good location at a good price, and don't mind the squeaks, rumbles, and bangs going throughout the evening, shaking you in your bed, this place is totally cool. Luxury it is not. I will not stay here again, but don't necessarily regret the money we saved, as we put that into a really nice hotel in the end of the trip. Also, there is a clearly marked "no marijuana smoking" sign on the rule manual in the room. I don't think this is strictly enforced, but be cautious for those of you who want to take something back to the room from the coffeeshops.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, overpriced and noisy neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, which was fine by us, but we thought it was way over priced. The bathroom is very small. There are lovely views from the front of the boat, but if you are at the back of the boat beware! There is a train line and some building work going on. By the looks of it the building work will be going on for awhile and the equipment they are using is quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amstel Botel is nothing special. But I was happy I stayed there because it was right next to Central Station in Amsterdam. After a long flight, we were fighting jet lag. It was also our first time in Europe, so we really needed a place like this that was so easy to find. Believe me, after a long flight, the last thing you need is the stress of trying to find your way around the streets or figure out the public transportation system. Take a nap first! Not only was the Botel right outside the station, if we were ever lost trying to find our way home, we could just ask people for directions to the station. If you've been to Amsterdam before or you think you'll have no problem finding your way around, there are plenty of other cheaper, more comfortable places to stay. But if you're a first-timer like me, I highly recommend the Botel for the first couple of days until you get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends August 2003 and found it to be ideal for the budget-minded. Location is good - you can see it from the entrance to Central Station, no need for taxi. 5 minute walk to centre of Amsterdam. Lets face it, we didnt come to Amsterdam to spend more time in our room, so if what youre looking for is a cheap, convenient roof over your head, then I think the Botel is great, if youre after the Hilton then go spend lots more money elsewhere. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: ollyscotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Botel for 2 nights. Room basic but clean, shower great, heater very hot. Fairly central and friendly staff. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: Raas
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Botel on 8 or 9 occasions and I have no complaints. The rooms are basic, there is no doubt, but they are very clean, the towels are changed daily, the radiators work, the view from the canal-side rooms is fabulous and the showers are good. I have been to Amsterdam about 13 times and most of them have been spent on the Botel. For the price, I have yet to find better value in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Botel is ok. Just that - ok. The place is just very, well, average. You may be able to find better hotels, but I did enjoy the Botel. The staff are really nice (apart from the chef - seems a little rude) The rooms are small, but have everything you need, and the views from the water side are fantastic. The price is good value for money, and the location (for some) is perfect - not to central, but central enough, so you can acctually get to sleep at night! Things could be improved upon (e.g, coffee/tea making facilitys in room, more vending machines etc..) But you really do get what you pay for. One thing I did like, is that they clean your room quite late, so you can have a lie in! Basically, I stayed there for the novelty factor of staying on a boat, try it, but It may not meet all your needs.

HotelInfo.Name: Amstel Botel
HotelInfo.Address: 3 MT Ondinaweg | NDSM-Pier 3, Amsterdam 1033 RG , The Netherlands
